characters: BACK TO THE BAR, IN THE PRESENT
SARAH OPENS HER EYES, WAKING UP...
AN ORB OF ORANGE LIGHT SWELLS
SHE LOSES CONTROL OF HER BODY
A SERIES, THE DAYS AND NIGHTS OF NYLES AND SARAH
A POWERFUL FORCE SUCKS NYLES DEEPER INTO THE CAVE
PINNING HIM BETWEEN THE TWO VEHICLES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We’re LOW TO THE GROUND, floating through a patch of Dese Marigolds swaying with the breeze, a stark contrast to th desolate, eerily silent surroundings. Until -- A TORTOISE trudges into frame, an imposing prehistoric be from this angle. Three healed SCARS mar its shell -- remn of a lifelong shitstorm. And it’s about to get worse. A MASSIVE EARTHQUAKE HITS, the tortoise halts. A CRACK splinters in the earth’s crust -- ORANGE LIGHT bursts up Mother Nature takes the tortoise, burying it alive. Or de Who knows? Who cares?

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: A PERFECTLY CLEAR NIGHT SKY. Full moon, every constellati As we PAN ACROSS, the muffled sound of Gram Parsons’ “Ret of the Grievous Angel” crescendos until we land on its so A ROADSIDE BIKER BAR. A true desert dive lost in time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PUSH IN on NYLES, 35 -- his head down on the bar, dressed swim trunks and a Hawaiian shirt, a full glass of whiskey the side. How he ended up here is anyone’s guess, but wha clear is a faded self-regard and fatalistic outlook. A fe BARFLIES throw darts and eat chili behind him. DARLA, 60s, a crusty regular, rubs his leg. Nyles shoots

dialogues.speaker: DARLA
dialogues.text: You okay, sweetheart?

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: I've felt everything I'll ever feel so I'll never feel ever again. Darla looks to TED THE BARTENDER --

dialogues.speaker: DARLA
dialogues.text: What’re you pouring this kid, Ted?

dialogues.speaker: TED THE BARTENDER
dialogues.text: That’s his first drink.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: I thought I knew how to live. But I didn’t. Or, I don’t? You know what I mean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darlin’, take a look around: whatever you're after, it ain’t here... Nyles stares back at Darla -- for an uncomfortably long t Darla cocks her head. What the fuck is this guy on?

dialogues.speaker: DARLA
dialogues.text: (to Ted the Bartender) You sure he didn’t take something?

dialogues.speaker: TED THE BARTENDER
dialogues.text: He’s sober. Kid’s just moping there. Nyles glares at Ted, defiantly shoots back his whiskey, a shatters his glass on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: I’m a fucking adult, Thaddeus.

dialogues.speaker: TED THE BARTENDER
dialogues.text: Talk to me like that and you'll be pulling your teeth from the bar. Nyles sizes up the barflies leering at him. He turns to T and holds a peace sign... and rotates it into a middle fi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We HEAR the sound of a FIGHT: SHOUTING, GLASS BREAKING -- The front door flies open and two GIANT BIKERS hurl Nyles face first onto the gravel parking lot, then go back insi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nyles trudges up a moonlit road. He takes a Tecate from h pocket and drinks as he reaches the top of a hill, where another source of LIGHT illuminates his face. He gazes ou with a look of recognition -- and resignation: A LARGE ESTATE at the end of the road, 100 yards down, in this otherwise pitch black desert valley. The MAIN HOUSE the center, with two large GUEST HOUSES, all connected through strands of twinkling lights extending down a long dirt driveway, packed full of hybrid cars. Nyles continues toward the estate, passing a SIGN: “Tala Abe's Wedding - November 9,” stenciled on driftwood in wh Futura font. Nyles SLAPS it down as he passes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nooooooovember ninth. PRE-LAP the sound of LAUGHTER FROM A CROWD --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Pinterest board come to life: Under an intricately desi web of lights fixed to palm trees, FIFTY WEDDING GUESTS o ages and dressed in all sorts of hip, eclectic attire sit tables assembled around a DANCE FLOOR, where MISTY (28, a bridesmaid with face gems) is giving a drawn-out speech -

dialogues.speaker: MISTY
dialogues.text: +. hashtag LifeGoals. So, this was supposed to be three minutes and I’m going on like ten. Sorry, not sorry. TALA (28, bride, flower crown) WOOOs to Misty, then cuddl with her groom, ABE (28, dapper ‘stache), high on marriag

dialogues.speaker: MISTY
dialogues.text: To wrap things up... Tala, girl, you're the sister I always wanted.

dialogues.speaker: TALA
dialogues.text: Love you, babe! AT THE BAR: SARAH HARRIS (32, cool tattoos, an emotional fortress, Tala’s real sister), scoffs at this as she wait for her wine to be filled. Luckily she’s far enough away so no one heard her besides DAISY THE BARTENDER (30, droll) who fills her wine halfwa

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Throw me a bone, this isn’t the day for moderation. After a brief staredown, Daisy fills the rest, letting it spill over the edges. Sarah smiles, tips $10, GLUGS half glass, and heads back to the tables. Everyone clinks their drinks for Tala and Abe to kiss --

dialogues.speaker: ABE
dialogues.text: That’s my cue -- Abe, always the charmer, pulls Tala in for a long kiss wh guests cheer. As he releases her, Sarah returns to her se across from them, watching with quiet judgement. Tala smiles at her sister, Sarah feigns one back.  Misty turns the page of her notes --

dialogues.speaker: MISTY
dialogues.text: Oh, wait, there’s still another page. I’1l make this quick. The laughter is dying out. This is really dragging on.

dialogues.speaker: MISTY
dialogues.text: I decided to Google the two most important things about marriage. Love and Commitment.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ. Tala shoots Sarah a look: Stop. Sarah nods: Yeah, sorry.

dialogues.speaker: MISTY
dialogues.text: Love is “to feel a deep romantic or sexual attachment to someone.” We know they’re fine in that department. Tala and Sarah’s parents, HOWARD and PIA (50s), wince. Sa lets out an unconvincing chuckle.

dialogues.speaker: MISTY
dialogues.text: And Commitment is “the state or quality of being dedicated to a cause, activity, etcetera.” Silence. Crickets. Not the triumphant ending she hoped fo

dialogues.speaker: TALA
dialogues.text: Woo-hoo! Tala and Abe stand and clap. Everyone else joins in appla

dialogues.speaker: MISTY
dialogues.text: Without further ado, let me bring up the maid of honor, the actual big sister of the bride, Sarah. All eyes land on Sarah -- caught mid wine sip.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Uh... Sarah doesn’t move. Howard leans across the table.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: Get on up there, peanut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one told me I was supposed to give a speech.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: Of course you’re supposed to give a speech, you’re the maid of honor. That's your main job.

dialogues.speaker: PIA
dialogues.text: She's been drinking, Howard. Sarah looks at her sister and Abe apologetically. Tala struggles to hide her disappointment.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (Subtitled Italian, Spanish, and French) Bonsoir mi familia et amici! Heads swivel to the dance floor. Nyles has commandeered a

dialogues.speaker: MISTY
dialogues.text: (away from her mic) What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Going in for the assist, babe. I'd like to share my thoughts on love.

dialogues.speaker: MISTY
dialogues.text: No, you wouldn’t.

dialogues.speaker: ABE
dialogues.text: Who's this guy?

dialogues.speaker: TALA
dialogues.text: Misty’s boyfriend. DANCE FLOOR, Nyles addresses the guests:

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Here’s what you want to hear, what I want to say, what you want me to say. What all this solipsistic horseshit means... Sarah stifles a laugh. Nyles notices.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: You're born lost, then you’re found... but we’re all just lost, am I right?  6. Sarah watches intently. Is he talking about me? Other gue trade awkward glances.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: But these two. Tala Anne Harris and Abraham Eugene Trent Schlieffen, you proudly wave the middle finger in the face of all that negativity. Then you give it a thumbs up. Some smiles begin to trickle through the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Your optimism, your selflessness, it’s in your blood. Just look at Nana and Papa Schlieffen. After narrowly escaping persecution in Nazi Germany, they devoted themselves to giving other refugees a safe passage to the U.S. NANA and PAPA SCHLIEFFEN (90s) smile at the shout out. Pa pats his Sudanese son, JERRY (20), on the back.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: They found hope, purpose, and empowerment through love. And I see that same fire burning in you two. You’1ll use your love for good. To inspire. To change. Tala leans into Abe --

dialogues.speaker: TALA
dialogues.text: How does he know all that? Abe shakes his head -- he has no clue.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Tala. Lovely, stunning Tala. Tonight’s true beacon of altruism. There’s something most people here probably don’t know about you, but they should, so they can all appreciate the wealth of humanity on display. I hope it’s okay? Tala has no idea what he’s about to say.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: It’s not just time and money that Tala gives to so many charitable causes. She donated her physical self: bone marrow. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While we all gorge that shit, she gave hers up to Baby Brother Nico, saving his life. Everyone is stunned by this revelation. Tala smiles at he hipster brother, NICO (23), through scattered applause --

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: You should clap, it’s scary! She gave so much. But now it’s time we give to you. Nyles locks eyes with Sarah, like he’s addressing her now

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Here you are. On the precipice of something much larger than any of us, facing that wide open road. It may seem frightening, filled with uncertainty. But remember: you are not alone. Tala and Abe look at their guests, hanging on every word.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Everyone here is your family. We are your world. We will bolster you up when you’re low, and we will cheer you on with delight in our eyes as you fulfill your every dream. So, raise a glass. Nyles takes a Tecate from the pocket of his swim trunks a holds it up, again looking at Sarah:

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: We may be born lost. But you have been found. (subtitled Arabic: “Welcome home."”) Marhabaan bik fi albayt. CHEERS and TEARS ALL AROUND, as we PRE LAP the tropical d beats of Brian Eno and Karl Hyde’s “Daddy's Car.”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BACCHANALIAN DANCE PARTY. Guests bounce, groove, grind energized by the LOVE in the air. Tala Bhangras with her Howard. Nana Schlieffen shimmies with Jerry from Sudan. A Soulja Boys with his new mother-in-law, Pia. Brother Nico makes out with ERIN (27, bridesmaid).  8. Sarah nurses her wine off to the side, watching Tala and RANDY (25, bolo tie, top knot), drunkenly dances up to he

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I already told you No earlier. What makes you think I changed my mind?

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: I dunno, you’ve had more to drink?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: You can’t say that to me --

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Oh whatever, I don’t have time for a lecture. Randy dances away, one hand in the air. Sarah shakes her head, and as she takes another sip of wine -- she locks e with Nyles, across the dance floor, smiling back at her. Nyles struts onto the dance floor, navigating the sea of partiers with a cool familiarity. He effortlessly anticip each passing guest’s dance moves and incorporates them in his own unique, complicated, and fucking bizarre routine. He weaves his way over and presents himself in front of Sarah, holding out his hand: Dance with me? She shakes her head. Not a chance. He tucks in his Hawaiian shirt, slicks his hair back, lic his fingers and grooms his eyebrows, then pirouettes. There’s intrigue on her face at least. Her aloof facade m dropping... But she still declines. Nyles shrugs, then performs a flawless cartwheel back to center of the floor, narrowly kicking multiple guests yet somehow, missing each one by inches. He continues letting loose with Sarah’s family -- high-fives to Howard and Abe twirl for Pia, an undeniable master of this universe. Off Sarah, increasingly curious about this odd stranger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Nyles waits patiently at THE BAR, something hits his senses. He looks around, suddenly alert... He squints -- OFF IN THE DISTANCE: behind some shrubs, shrouded in dark a silhouette, swaying side to side... Is that a person?  Nyles SNIFFS the air...

dialogues.speaker: SARAH, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: What are you smelling? Startled, Nyles spins to find Sarah behind him. Covering, sniffs her hair.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Viktor and Rolf Flowerbomb, right? Sarah cocks her head.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Uh, yeah. That’s weird.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: I know my hair mists. Dated a girl who bathed in it.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I hate it, but it was a birthday present from Tala last year and she'd kill me if I didn’t wear it. Daisy the Bartender returns with two COCKTAILS. Nyles off one to Sarah.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: I always order two drinks at a time. Saves an extra trip.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Or maybe you’re an alcoholic? Nyles shrugs: Yeah, maybe. She takes the drink, they chee then meander away from the bar.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: You're Misty’s boyfriend, right? I don’t think we met at the rehearsal last night. I’m Sarah.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Nyles. So what’s the deal, you don’t like to dance?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Plantar fasciitis.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Respect. Sarah smiles, just as Nana and Papa Schlieffen interject.  10.

dialogues.speaker: PAPA SCHLIEFFEN
dialogues.text: Son, I’ve been to more weddings in my life than you could imagine --

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: You'd be surprised.

dialogues.speaker: PAPA SCHLIEFFEN
dialogues.text: I have to say that your speech was the best wedding speech I have ever heard. Shukraan. Papa Schlieffen pats Nyles on the shoulder and walks off.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: You don’t actually believe any of that stuff you spouted, right?

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Not a word. We’re all fucking alone. An O0.S. COUGH -- Nyles anxiously glances at the shrubs a that swaying silhouette still there.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Hey, uh, want to go somewhere we can be alone?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Wow. That’s a little forward. What’s the rush?

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Your mom’s about to sing and I can’t handle that right now. Nyles gestures to the DANCE FLOOR, where Pia and her two SISTERS are setting up to sing a song. As Sarah looks over, Nyles glances back to the desert shrubs... then Randy emerges from behind, zipping up his pants. He was just peeing. Nyles exhales with total relie and turns back to Sarah with a renewed ease about him.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: What would Misty think about us running off together?

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: ANGLE THROUGH A WINDOW: Misty leans against the bathroom as TREVOR (25, groomed beard, Zara suit) goes down on her

dialogues.speaker: SARAH, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Can't say I ever really liked her.  11.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVEAL: Nyles and Sarah squeeze next to each other, spyin the scene through a small window.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: She has her moments. But yeah. This one hurts.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: You know she tried to get Tala to make her the maid-of-honor because I missed the bachelorette party? Manipulative bitch. (then) Who’s the guy?

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Ex-boyfriend. Trevor.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Why don’t you go in and stop them?

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: There isn’t a world where these two don’t end up together. Nyles stops looking, leans against the house, gazes out t the desert. He actually does seem a little affected by th Sarah slides down beside him. Misty’s MOANS continue.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Well, if it makes you feel any better, you gave a great speech and everyone out there loves you.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: That’s true.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: On the other hand, they see me as a liability who fucks around and drinks too much.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Why would they think that?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Because I fuck around and drink too much.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Mmm. Don’t we all?  12. MISTY SQUEALS -- Nyles gestures behind him: See what I me

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: And now they just worry and try to take care of me, but it’s suffocating.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Yeah, I was never great with unsolicited help. Like, don’t tell me how to live my life.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Exactly, I can fend for myself.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Of course you can. You don’t need a leg up -- Another MOAN, followed by --

dialogues.speaker: MISTY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: -- hold my legs up --

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: That was weird.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: This is so fucked up.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Soooo fucked up. They both look back through the window.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Kind of hot though. They share a smile. Locked in. She feels it, he feels it, sparks fly, Misty climaxes, shit’s getting real. Connecti

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nyles and Sarah make out on top of a small boulder, not f from the party. Sarah keeps trying to untie Nyles’ board shorts but they’re double knotted.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Okay, I give up. Take off your clothes.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: You got it.  13. Nyles stands up and seductively unbuttons the top button his shirt, the second... then he RIPS it off. Nyles moves to his board shorts, but they’re tied too tig for him, too. His faux suave-ness on hold as he focuses i

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Almost got ‘em... And... he gets it! He yanks them off, so he’s down to jus his boxer-briefs.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: You wear underwear under your bathing suit? THWACK! AN ARROW FLIES INTO NYLES’ SHOULDER.

dialogues.speaker: AGGGHH FUCK
dialogues.text: Some BLOOD sprayed onto Sarah’s face -- SHE SCREAMS! Nyles spots a MAN (50s) in army fatigues and a HUNTING BO the base of the boulder.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: I thought I smelled you, you piece of shit! The Man fires another arrow, GRAZING Nyles’ left love han He SCREAMS IN AGONY.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: What the fuck is going on?! Who is that?! The Man begins to climb up to them. Nyles staggers away f Sarah, slides down the opposite face of the boulder, and off into the desert, the Man in pursuit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nyles rounds a corner and pauses to catch his breath. He turns around. Looks like he lost the Man. THWACK! AN ARROW FLIES INTO HIS THIGH. Nyles SCREAMS.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: You're a sick fuck, Roy! Nyles sprints with everything he has around a bend. ROY ( man) scurries out of the shadows after him.  14.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nyles hobbles around the bend, losing blood, slowing down and he collapses before a mound of boulders blanketing th side of a hill... almost at his destination: A TRIANGLE-SHAPED CAVE in the hillside, twenty feet ahead But he can’t make it in time -- Roy’s grunting just aroun the bend. Quick decision -- Nyles army crawls to the othe side of a nearby Joshua Tree, concealed by darkness. He h his breath, remaining completely silent, just as -- Roy rounds the bend -- and stops before the cave. Roy loo around, but he can’t see Nyles. It’s too dark. NYLES’ POV: Roy’s menacing silhouette, fifteen feet away. shouts into the cave.

dialogues.speaker: ROY
dialogues.text: Keep running, shit bird. I’1l always find you. Then, with a disappointed sigh, Roy marches forward -- in the cave. And after a few seconds... Roy vanishes. Weird. Relieved, yet still in excruciating pain, Nyles uses his remaining strength to crawl into the cave, following Roy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nyles goes deeper, groaning and wincing with each movemen

dialogues.speaker: SARAH, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (a loud whisper) Hey! He turns his head to find Sarah, twenty feet back, standi at the mouth of the cave.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Stop! No no no --

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Don’t come in here --

dialogues.speaker: MISTY, (PRE-LAP)
dialogues.text: Wake up.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. NYLES AND MISTY’S BEDROOM - MORNING Nyles wakes up in bed, shirtless, free from any injuries scars. He rolls over with a yawn to find Misty wrapped in towel, leg up on the bed as she moisturizes. Her hair and make-up are wedding ready.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: That’s a good leg. She gives him a cheeky smile. INT. NYLES AND MISTY’S BEDROOM - BATHROOM - MORNING Misty and Nyles have sex. And it’s a struggle. (This is t same bathroom we saw Misty and Trevor in.)

dialogues.speaker: MISTY
dialogues.text: You close? I can’t start sweating.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Working on it, darling. After a few more thrusts, Misty stops, frustrated.

dialogues.speaker: MISTY
dialogues.text: I have to get ready. Just finish on your own. Watch me, I don’t care. Misty heads to the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Cool, yeah, that’s romantic. Nyles tries masturbating, watching her dig in her suitcas But he catches his reflection in the mirror -- sweat bead on his chest hair, fat jiggling with each stroke. He grim back, full of shame, a weak man trying to feel something. So he strokes harder, faster, FASTER --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starfished on the bed, Nyles cycles through every channel TV, never stopping. Misty pulls on her bridesmaid’s dress  16.

dialogues.speaker: MISTY
dialogues.text: No offense, but you’re the only guy I’ve been with who’s had a problem coming. And don’t say the age thing. I’ve had older boyfriends. Nyles keeps his eyes locked on the TV.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: It’s not you, it’s me.

dialogues.speaker: MISTY
dialogues.text: Yeah, no shit.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: I meant it’s you, not me.

dialogues.speaker: MISTY
dialogues.text: Funny.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: I meant kill me.

dialogues.speaker: MISTY
dialogues.text: Look, I know weddings make you super uncomfortable, but please don’t bring our drama here. This day doesn’t belong to us. It’s Tala and Abe's. Nyles gives a thumbs up. Misty doesn’t buy his sincerity, also doesn’t have time to argue. She escapes to the bathr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howard carries a driftwood sign down the driveway. At a f in the road, he hammers it in the dirt with a mallet. REV THE SIGN: “Tala & Abe’s Wedding - November 9.”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IN SLOW MOTION: Nyles does a cannonball into the pool, soaking the pool deck with his splash.

dialogues.speaker: MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: Nyles floats on an inflatable pizza raft, beer in hand, a in his pepperoni cup holders. Jerry (from Sudan) swims by KICKBOARD. Nyles offers him a beer from a BOX by the pool  17.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: (accepting the beer) Shukraan. After a few moments:

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: Good day so far?

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Today, tomorrow, yesterday, it’s all the same. Yourself?

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: Today is young. Ask me again at the end. Anything can happen. Jerry shoots Nyles some flirtatious side-eye.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Not today, sauce pot. Nice try, though. Jerry laughs nervously.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You! Sarah storms up to the side of the pool, almost slipping the water. Nyles FREEZES --

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: (to Nyles) What the fuck did you do to me? Jerry looks at Nyles, horrified. Nyles sees Jerry, looks back to Sarah -- panics -- and submerges himself to escape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nyles dodges a bombardment of Tecate cans thrown from abo We’re with him for as long as he can hold his breath, whi we hear Sarah’s muffled shouts -- SARAH JUMPS IN THE POOL, grabs Nyles’ hair, yanks him up Nyles surfaces with a GASP, arms FLAILING --

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Tell me what the fuck is going on!  18. But before Nyles can come up with an answer:

dialogues.speaker: TALA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Sarah! Sarah turns: Tala, hair and make-up wedding-ready, is crossing the yard --

dialogues.speaker: TALA
dialogues.text: Oh my god, what are you doing?! Tala reaches the pool deck -- and SLIPS ON WET CONCRETE - her face SMACKS the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SARAH'S FACE -- all horror and confusion -- hiding behind bush as she watches: THWACK! AN ARROW FLIES INTO NYLES’ THIGH. Nyles SCREAMS.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: You're a sick fuck, Roy! Nyles sprints with everything he has around a bend. Roy scurries out of the shadows after him. Sarah waits. Listening intently... It’s quiet. But she can’t miss whatever the fuck this is so she follo after in a full sprint --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah rounds the corner but no one is there. She hears a SOUND -- a faint groan. Coming from -- THE TRIANGLE CAVE. Sarah follows the groans -- until she’ the mouth of the cave. She can faintly make out Nyles crawling twenty feet in.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: (a loud whisper) Hey! Nyles turns his head --

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Stop! No no no --  19.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Don’t come in here -- -- Nyles vanishes into the cave. No sound, no orange ligh All goes silent.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Hello? Nothing. But something about the cave draws her in. Some intangibl urge she can’t resist, this black hole of both curiosity escape, and she has to know what’s inside. She steps forw

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah’s hands trace the walls for guidance. The moonlight dims as she goes deeper... Until it’s completely PITCH BL Then -- a faint sliver of an orange light appears in the distance, growing brighter the closer she gets. It lights her face, revealing a mix of wonder and fear --

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: What the fuuuuuck???

dialogues.speaker: SHE LOSES CONTROL OF HER BODY
dialogues.text: -- A BRIGHT BURST OF ORANGE --—

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: SARAH’S CLOSED EYE LIDS The SUN beats down on them. Her eyelids fly open --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The harsh ray of sunlight slices through a gap in the curtains onto her face. She shoots up, assesses her surroundings, piecing things together... This room is familiar. Shag carpet, black silk sheets, clothes scattered on the floor, someone in the shower. Wa that all a dream?  20. She jumps out of bed, quickly dresses, peers out a WINDOW Howard and Nico carry sections of the altar, wrapped in plastic; Pia talks to the FLORIST by the main house. They setting up for the wedding.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: What the fuck? She hears the shower turn off. PANIC. She has to leave --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The taupe backside of the estate. Desert shrubs, a noisy unit, and, above it, a small window... which OPENS. Sarah wiggles out head first but gets stuck at her waist.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Come on... O.S. VOICES approach. She FREEZES, looking toward two lar trash bins by the corner -- Howard and Nico appear with giant balls of plastic wrap. don’t see Sarah teetering out the window as they smash th plastic in the bin. Howard shuts it and they walk off. Once out of sight, Sarah uses all her strength -- STRAINI and pushes OUT -- taking the entire window frame with her SLAMS onto the air conditioner, BOUNCES off, and lands on CACTUS. A silent SCREAM --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah hurries to her Kia rental car, parked among the oth and gets in the front seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah catches her breath, steadying herself. She checks h PHONE: The date and time - 9:40am, November 9. She drops it. What’s happening? She stares into the rearv mirror and SLAPS herself, again and again, sanity crackin

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Wake up. Wake up. BEHIND HER, we see Jerry in his swim trunks, towel over t shoulder, kickboard in hand. He stops to watch, weirded o  21.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: (shouting) Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Nothing makes sense. They stare at each other for a moment -- helpless terror her face, confusion on his. Too much for him to handle, h scurries off to the backyard. She drops her head onto the steering wheel, giving up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON SARAH as she quietly opens the front door, hoping to g unnoticed... but is hit by the mad rush of people bustlin about to set up, the onslaught of wedding decorations, Ta and Abe's engagement POSTER before her. Nausea strikes --

dialogues.speaker: PIA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: There you are! Pia stands on a ladder tying photos of Tala and Abe to tw string across the room.

dialogues.speaker: PIA
dialogues.text: (shouting out) Tala! I found Sarah! Pia waddles off the ladder and grabs Sarah --

dialogues.speaker: PIA
dialogues.text: We were looking for you all morning, come on -- She leads Sarah into the --

dialogues.speaker: KITCHEN
dialogues.text: Where Nana Schlieffen ties ribbon around silverware and N blows up balloons. Howard cools off with a wet washcloth his neck while drinking a glass of water.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: Sarah, peanut! (gives her a kiss) You must’ve gotten up early, I checked your room at six --

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Yeah... I went on a hike.  22.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: You look exhausted. Stay hydrated. Howard offers her his water.

dialogues.speaker: PIA
dialogues.text: Tala should be done with her make- up soon, so you need to be ready.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I need a minute.

dialogues.speaker: PIA
dialogues.text: She made a specific order for you girls, and we already moved Misty up because we couldn’t find you. Sarah's gaze darts around the room, her mind racing. Pia looks

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: (to Howard) This is really happening, right?

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: I don’t understand the question.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: This day already happened. over at Howard with a concerned look...

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: What are you saying?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: It was real. It felt so real.

dialogues.speaker: PIA
dialogues.text: Are you on drugs again? Sarah stops suddenly, staring out the window to the backy IN THE POOL: Jerry... and Nyles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah storms up to the side of the pool, almost slipping the wet pool deck. Nyles freezes at the sight of her.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: What the fuck did you do to me? Jerry looks at Nyles, horrified. Nyles panics -- and submerges himself to escape.  23. Sarah grabs cans from the box of Tecate, firing into the water at Nyles while she berates him.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Hey! Come back up here! Jerry uses his kickboard to shield himself. SARAH JUMPS IN THE POOL, grabs Nyles’ hair, yanks him up Nyles surfaces with a GASP, arms FLAILING --

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Tell me what the fuck is going on! But before Nyles can come up with an answer:

dialogues.speaker: TALA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Sarah! Sarah turns: Tala is crossing the yard --

dialogues.speaker: TALA
dialogues.text: Oh my god, what are you doing?! Tala reaches the pool deck -- and SLIPS ON WET CONCRETE - her face SMACKS the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tala WAILS, clasping her bloody mouth. Sarah stands besid her, drenched and shellshocked -- Tala grabs her hand -- It’s all out pandemonium; a mess of snot, tears, and stre of mascara. Pia, Misty, and Erin (bridesmaid) dab Tala’s eyes, Nico looks on with a morbid curiosity, Howard frantically paces around the bedroom on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: Nico! Get me the teeth -- Tala WAILS some more. Nico hands Tala’s TEETH to Howard.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: (into phone, re: teeth) The three front teeth are broken in half, one full canine... I’d guess two millimeters? ... Yes, the wedding is today... in six hours... Sarah silently observes this nightmare... We go into her BLURRY FACES coming into focus to scream at her:  24.

dialogues.speaker: PIA ERIN
dialogues.text: Get ice, Sarah! Help! Help, Sarah! Do something! «+. a nauseating nightmare... swirling pastels...

dialogues.speaker: MISTY
dialogues.text: Why were you in the pool?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I can’t be here. This doesn’t make any sense. None of this makes any fucking sense!

dialogues.speaker: PIA
dialogues.text: You're making it worse! Sarah flees to the door, flings it open, and STARTLES whe she finds Abe listening in --

dialogues.speaker: ABE
dialogues.text: What happened? How is she?

dialogues.speaker: TALA
dialogues.text: Don’t let him in! He can’t see me!

dialogues.speaker: ABE
dialogues.text: I need to see you, baby!

dialogues.speaker: TALA
dialogues.text: Don’t fucking come in here!

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: (covers phone; to Abe) She'll be okay. I found a dentist in Cathedral City... (into phone) Yes, sorry. We’ll be there soon! Abe leans in close to Sarah, quietly asking:

dialogues.speaker: ABE
dialogues.text: How bad is it? Sarah just stares back, trapped by this bizarre situation

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: Everyone! I’m taking Tala into town. This dentist glues teeth! Tala WAILS -- it’s all too much -- Sarah VOMITS on the fl Abe leans back, grossed out --

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: No, Sarah, no!  25. Howard grabs a towel, tosses it to Sarah, commands the ro

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: Alright! Pia, keep setting up --

dialogues.speaker: PIA
dialogues.text: I am going with you. Pia cradles Tala in her arms.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: Okay. Girls, you’re on table decor. Jerry and Nico are here to help. Your bride-slash-wedding planner needs some emergency surgery so -- He looks at Sarah, but she’s useless right now, so --

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: Misty, you’re in charge. All hands on deck! We can do this! off Tala’s WAILING --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nyles slouches in a lounge chair, but he’s far from relax He stares off, dwelling on the chaotic turn of events. cans litter the pool bottom. Beer Sarah wanders out of the house, physically and emotionall drained, and collapses onto one of the chairs. Nyles tries to bury any semblance of guilt... and smiles he cracks open another Tecate.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: So I guess you followed me.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: What’s going on?

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: I tried stopping you. (then) Tecate?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: But what is this? When is this?  26.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: This is today. Today is yesterday. Tomorrow is today. And so on. One of those infinite loops. Sarah’s mind is melting. Grasping for any help, or hope.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: How do I stop it? I don’t want tomorrow to be today. I want tomorrow to be tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: That's never going to happen. Tomorrow will always and forever be today. He holds out a beer to her again, but she just sinks back into her chair, approaching, if not already at, complete hopelessness. Nyles feels... bad? A little.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: At least Tala’s teeth will be back tomorrow. So she’ll still have her dream wedding. That’s good, right? Ignoring this, Sarah looks to the canyon beyond the prope

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Which way is that cave? Nyles sighs and points. Sarah walks off, determined. Nyles sips his beer and attempts to continue his sky gazi but he’s clearly bothered. His routine’s been fucked with

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Fuuuuuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah mutters to herself, scanning the boulders, searchin for the cave. From the edge of the canyon, we get a clear picture of how big it is, and how small Sarah is within i

dialogues.speaker: LATER...
dialogues.text: The afternoon sun blazes on. Sarah is completely lost, ju miles of boulders and hills that all look the same. She passes an empty tortoise shell with three distinct cracks

dialogues.speaker: LATER...
dialogues.text: Sarah, out of steam and hope, sits on a small boulder, waiting for something, anything. But there’s only that ee silence, that desert wind. She lies on her back. Giving u

dialogues.speaker: LATER...
dialogues.text: The sun begins to set. Sarah hasn’t moved, made evident b festering sunburn. She stares dead-eyed at the sky. Then Nyles steps up, drinking a beer. He offers her a sip and quickly takes it. Any liquid helps.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Please. Where is it?

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: You have to wait.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Fuck you. Just tell me. Nyles gives up... and points to the other side of the can Almost directly across from them. But there’s no cave.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Where? Nyles looks toward the horizon... watching... He takes a steps back, to the left, like he’s looking for his mark..

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Wait for it... Almost... Okay. (dead serious) I am the Antichrist. Nyles SNAPS his fingers -- and an EARTHQUAKE BEGINS. Sarah freezes, bracing herself -- Nyles casually drinks his beer as ROCKS TUMBLE out of pla careening across the canyon, landing all AROUND him. The earthquake stops. Nyles, satisfied with himself, look back at Sarah -- what the fuck was that?

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: I'm kidding, there is no god, the earthquake happens every day. But -- Nyles points across the canyon -- to the cave, right ther plain sight. Sarah heads over, intent on ending this day.  28.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: You won’t find what you’re looking for in there. Once you go in the day will just restart, right back to wherever you woke up this morning. Sarah pauses.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Same thing if you stick around. The second you fall asleep it just starts over. Weird, huh?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: But will this day end if I go in there?

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Sure. For you. Sarah continues into the cave and vanishes in the darknes All alone now, Nyles sips his beer, conflicted. He looks toward the direction of the wedding, and all of its tumul And into the cave, now with an entirely different feeling dread. He hangs his head, unable to make a decision.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: SARAH’S CLOSED EYE LIDS OPENING UP -- -- but she immediately squints at a harsh ray of sunlight

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sun through the curtains. Shag carpet. Black silk sheets. Shower running. She shoots up, peeks OUTSIDE: Howard and carry the altar; Pia talks to the florist. It’s all the s

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: No, no, no. In a panic, Sarah turns around, scans the room: The bathr door. The window to escape. Her keys on the bedside table

dialogues.speaker: MISTY, (PRE-LAP)
dialogues.text: Wake up. INT. NYLES’ AND MISTY’S BEDROOM - MORNING Nyles wakes up and finds Misty, in her towel, moisturizin her leg. She glances at him, as if expecting a comment.  29.

dialogues.speaker: MISTY
dialogues.text: Good morning... Nyles curls into a ball, not ready to face the day.

dialogues.speaker: I./E. SARAH'S CAR
dialogues.text: Sarah races down a desert highway. A blank look on her fa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nyles cautiously steps up to the pool, lingering by the e anticipating Sarah’s arrival. Jerry kickboards across.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Have you seen Sarah around?

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: No, sorry. Maybe she’s with Tala? Nyles, relieved, gives a thumbs up, then falls into the p

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah downs three 5-Hour-Energy shots as she fills her ca

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still wet from the pool, Nyles pours every alcohol he can find into a blender, as the family prepares for the weddi

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: She didn’t leave a note or anything? Are you sure she didn’t text back?

dialogues.speaker: PIA
dialogues.text: Check my phone if you don’t believe me. Sarah realized the day wasn’t about her so she left.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: Don’t say that. Nyles flips ON the blender -- and it’s LOUD. Pia and Howa both glare at him, but he doesn’t take his eyes off the cyclone of booze. He flips it off and pours into his cup.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Or she’s scared.  30.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: Who, Sarah? Of what?

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Weddings, families, commitment, people, death, intimacy, melanoma, judgement. Sauce. Pia and Howard stare back at him.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: (resigned) She’1l be back. Nyles heads out to the pool.

dialogues.speaker: I./E. SARAH'S CAR
dialogues.text: Sarah passes a SIGN: “Welcome to Texas.” Windows down, Sa SLAPS her face to stay awake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the crowd laughs at Misty’s speech, Nyles watches Dais fill his wine. He drinks and looks at Sarah’s empty chair then over to Tala. She’s staring at it too, missing her s

dialogues.speaker: I./E. SARAH'S CAR
dialogues.text: Sarah is still driving. Wide awake. 320z coffee in hand. INT. NYLES AND MISTY’S BEDROOM - LATE NIGHT Nyles stumbles in drunk and flops on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: MISTY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: -- hold my legs up --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Austin, TX. Sarah parks her car in front of a small home. INT. SARAH’S HOUSE - KITCHEN - EARLY MORNING Photo booth strips of Sarah with various friends cover th fridge, depicting a life full of partying and bars. Dishe are piled in the sink. A lone cup in the drying rack.  31. Sarah grabs the cup and fills it with water. She drinks, it back in the drying rack, then moves into her --

dialogues.speaker: BEDROOM
dialogues.text: And finds her two cats on an unmade bed. She shuts her bl to block the early morning sun and crawls in. She stares at the ceiling for a moment, mind still racing.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: This is all a dream. This is alla dream. This is all a dream. She shuts her eyes. CLOSE ON Sarah’s face... Her closed eyes... Then -- A SLIVER OF SUNLIGHT STRIKES HER FACE. Her eyes open. It’s a new day. Shag carpet, black silk sheets. Someone in the shower. She’s back. Fuck.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. NYLES’ AND MISTY’S BEDROOM - MORNING Nyles sleeps in bed. Just another day. Misty is in the bathroom. A KNOCK. Nyles doesn’t flinch. The person outsi tries to open the door but it’s locked. KNOCK KNOCK. Nyles snores through it.

dialogues.speaker: MISTY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Are you getting that? Nope. Misty hurries out of the bathroom and opens the doo

dialogues.speaker: MISTY
dialogues.text: Sarah? Sarah barges in and sees Nyles in bed.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Wake up. Nyles moans. Too early for him.

dialogues.speaker: MISTY
dialogues.text: Uh... What are you doing? Sarah ignores her. She spots Nyles’ foot sticking out of sheets, grabs his pinky toe and SNAPS it.

dialogues.speaker: MISTY
dialogues.text: What the fuck, Sarah?! Nyles shoots awake, wincing in pain.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Get dressed. I can’t be here anymore. Sarah leaves. Misty, totally lost, looks at Nyles.

dialogues.speaker: MISTY
dialogues.text: Are you fucking cheating on me?

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: (groggy) No, you're cheating on me, ya goof. Misty’s stunned. Nyles grabs his clothes and follows Sara INT. SARAH’S CAR - DRIVING - MORNING Sarah turns onto the highway. Nyles sits shotgun.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: You have a destination in mind, or are you just driving aimlessly? Because if so, I’d much rather go for a float.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Stop talking. Let me think. He offers her a beer and she swiftly accepts, pleasing hi

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: What is this? I get that it’s the same day. But what is it? Nyles inhales, gearing up to give what feels like a rehea speech, aimed at quashing any further questioning.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: (in one breath) I have no idea what it is. This might be life, this might be death, might be a dream, I could be imagining you, you could be imagining me, might be purgatory, or this might be a glitch in the computer simulation we're in. And in another breath:  33.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: So, after a while I stopped caring altogether. The only way to actually live in this world is to embrace the fact that nothing matters. Disappointment, regret, guilt will just drive you bonkers. Nyles exhales, sips a beer.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Then what’s the point of living? Sarah presses down on the gas, the car accelerates.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Well, you have no choice but to live, so I guess you gotta learn to suffer existence.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: So we can’t die?

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: No. The day just starts over. Or maybe we can, but I haven't figured out the proper way to kill myself and I’ve tried them all. (sips his beer) Slow down a bit.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Why slow down if nothing matters? Sarah's becoming unhinged. Nyles tries a softer approach.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: You have to find what brings you peace. For me it’s floating in the pool with a beer. I think everyone can find peace in that. So why don’t we turn this car around and hit the water? Sarah stares ahead, picking up speed.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: No. I need to get out of this. Sarah keeps a serious, dogged expression. She stomps down the gas and the car quickly gains speed. 100mph -- 115mph Nyles grows irritated. He unbuckles his seatbelt and maneuvers into an odd, super unsafe crash position.  34.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Bracing for a quick death. We can’t die, but pain is a very real thing. There’s nothing worse than dying slowly in the ICU. Sarah keeps gaining speed. But at another glance at Nyles his crash position, she too unbuckles her seatbelt. ON THE ROAD AHEAD, a truck drives in the oncoming lane. S doesn’t let up. She slowly drifts into the other lane. Nyles peeks up to see. He still shows no sign of fear. Mo annoyed than anything.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: We can skip this whole phase and just have a drink at the bar. (off her silence) Or not. Whatever. See you tomorrow. Sarah stares ahead -- the oncoming truck gets closer, fla its lights -- but Sarah doesn’t slow down. Closer...Close HORN BLARING -- SARAH’S FACE -- NYLES takes one more sip of his beer --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Head in her hands, Sarah stares down at a double whiskey shot, still in a serious existential funk. Nyles leans against the bar, at home in this desert dive.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: As I was saying, you have to find peace. One thing that’s nice is no one knows me at the wedding. Besides Misty, of course. You might have trouble with that.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: They don’t want me there, I don’t want to be there, so it’s a win-win for all. Sarah shoots back her whiskey and slams it down for a ref Sore subject. Nyles notices. Sarah shifts course --  35.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I drove all the way back to Austin. Still woke up here.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: That’s the way it works. You can go anywhere you want. She looks at him: Really?

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: As long as you’re awake, you can keep moving. I smoked a bunch of crystal and made it to Equatorial Guinea once. Big waste. They detained me once I got off the plane, I crashed within minutes, back in the desert I found myself.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: (intrigued) I can go anywhere...

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Yeah, but you don’t want to.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Don’t fucking tell me what I want.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Okay, then go. I don’t give a shit. I’m just saying that it’s a hassle.

dialogues.speaker: WOOHOO
dialogues.text: At the DARTS BOARD behind them: Darla hits a bullseye. A disgruntled BIKER hands her cash.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Darla! You and me. Hundred bucks. Darla looks at Nyles for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: DARLA
dialogues.text: Who the fuck are you?

dialogues.speaker: MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: Nyles demonstrates perfect dart throwing form and hits a bullseye with his first dart. Darla’s stunned by his skil  36.

dialogues.speaker: DARLA
dialogues.text: Don’t you know how to hustle, kid?

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: I’m an honest man, Darla. You are going to lose this game, but you can keep your money. He smiles, readying the next dart. Sarah stands by, watch Nyles throws it -- and it goes in the same hole as his fi dart, side by side, metal on metal. And it reminds Sarah

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Wait. Jesus. Who was that guy with the hunting bow? Darla cocks her head, just as Nyles throws his final dart and misses the board.

dialogues.speaker: FUCK.
dialogues.text: He collects himself, marks his score on the chalk scorebo and gives the darts to Darla, holding her hand.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Your eyes and hand are one.

dialogues.speaker: DARLA
dialogues.text: My eyes and hands are one. Nyles keeps watching Darla, Sarah keeps staring at him, waiting for an answer. He finally looks over.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: That was Roy. He was a guest at the wedding. Abe’s dad’s cousin, of the Schlieffen clan. Other than that, I know very little about the dude.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: But why was he trying to kill you? Nyles sighs. Even thinking about Roy bothers him...

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: One night, a very long time ago, I partied with Roy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We follow a SERVER through the COCKTAIL HOUR with a tray tuna tartare on wonton crisps. Guests clutching signature cocktails snag bites as she passes --

dialogues.speaker: NYLES, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: This was back in the early days, before I really became acquainted with everyone. I was still feeling my way through... A HAND taps the server on the shoulder, and we turn aroun with her to find: ROY (50s), white hair, white teeth, gre suit, much less frightening in the light. He grabs a wont

dialogues.speaker: ROY
dialogues.text: This tuna?

dialogues.speaker: SERVER
dialogues.text: Yeah. He takes a bite --

dialogues.speaker: ROY
dialogues.text: Mmm. Tasty. The server holds the tray as he takes two more. She moves but we follow Roy meander away, smiling at guests he clea doesn’t know while he continues to eat, until he makes it

dialogues.speaker: THE BAR
dialogues.text: Where Nyles talks nonsense to Daisy the Bartender.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: I know you know. But you don’t know that I know. Or do you know? Daisy stares back, unenthused.

dialogues.speaker: ROY
dialogues.text: You being a dick to Daisy? It takes a patient soul to put up with pricks like us. (to Daisy) A more beautiful barkeep I never did see... Moscato, please.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: “What might have been and what has been point to one end, which is always present.”  38. Roy considers Nyles, intrigued by this drunk prophet.

dialogues.speaker: ROY
dialogues.text: Actually Dais’, two whiskey shots. Daisy pours the shots, hating life. Roy flips through a massive wad of cash, puts a single dollar bill in the tip Roy hands Nyles one of the shots and holds his up --

dialogues.speaker: ROY
dialogues.text: To the struggle. Nyles and Roy take their shots -- just as the guests APPL around the dance floor. The WEDDING PARTY makes their gra entrance. There’s Misty and Trevor, Erin and Nico, Sarah Randy... And the guests go nuts as Tala and Abe stroll ou

dialogues.speaker: ROY
dialogues.text: Why do people clap? What’s to clap about?

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: People clapped when the Titanic set sail. Roy chuckles.

dialogues.speaker: ROY
dialogues.text: Confucius said: Marriage is a seemingly bottomless pit of sorrow that makes you forget who you are.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: He did not. Roy smirks at Nyles:

dialogues.speaker: ROY
dialogues.text: But there is a bottom, my friend. And it’s dark down here. Nyles gives Roy the hang loose sign.

dialogues.speaker: ROY
dialogues.text: (leaning in) You wanna dance a little? Roy taps his nose.

dialogues.speaker: ROY
dialogues.text: The Officiant in the dumb suit --  39. Roy gestures to THE OFFICIANT (30s), a bearded guy in a h Nudie suit (A rhinestone embroidered cowboy suit), who MC the wedding party entrance.

dialogues.speaker: ROY
dialogues.text: Turd bird has a bag of sweets in his pocket. I tried to corner him in the bathroom, but he won’t share -- But Nyles walks away from Roy before he can finish. From ROY’S POV, Nyles walks across the dance floor up to Officiant, reaches into his pocket, pulls out a bag of pi The Officiant buries his shock and continues to MC as Nyl ignoring quizzical looks, returns to an amused Roy.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: (holding up bag) Got ‘em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nyles and Roy grin at each other, swaying, nostrils caked different colored powders. Roy keeps licking his lips wil Nyles’ gaze goes from watching this to the bathroom door handle jiggling. Someone tries to open it -- POUNDS on it

dialogues.speaker: THE OFFICIANT, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Give me back my shit! Open up! Nyles’ eyes drift back to Roy -- but he’s vanished.

dialogues.speaker: ROY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (whispering) Over here. Roy crouches in the bathtub.

dialogues.speaker: ROY
dialogues.text: Hop in. Nyles joins him. More POUNDING on the door.

dialogues.speaker: THE OFFICIANT, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Come on, I know you’re in there. Roy Shhhhs Nyles. Nyles Shhhhs him back. They escalate Shhhhing, on and on into GIGGLES --

dialogues.speaker: THE OFFICIANT, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You guys suck.  40. Roy grabs Nyles by the back of his neck and brings him cl sweaty forehead to forehead, real intimate --

dialogues.speaker: ROY
dialogues.text: I won’t let him hurt you, friend.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: We're in the shit.

dialogues.speaker: ROY
dialogues.text: We are the shit. You and I, we’re in this together. Nyles stares back, eyes fully dilated, but he begins to look... scared. Not of Roy, but of everything happening. eyes roll back, but Roy SLAPS him awake --

dialogues.speaker: ROY
dialogues.text: My boy, I got you. We’re alive. Roy holds Nyles head to his breast to comfort him as the POUNDING continues --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IN SLOW-MOTION: Nyles and Roy tango on the dance floor, t out the world around them, lost in this blur of life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nyles and Roy lie on their backs, staring at the stars, o of their fucking minds, stoned, tripping.

dialogues.speaker: ROY
dialogues.text: This is the greatest night of my life. The Earth, the stars, the holy mother. Grace and love. Peace and personality.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: I’m not seeing it, Roy.

dialogues.speaker: ROY
dialogues.text: You'll find it. I know you will. Otherwise, what’s the point? They go silent for a moment, star gazing. We see Nyles’ e dart as he stares up -- THE SKY: Nyles’ creates his own constellations, connectin star to star with trails of light zig zagging into a shapeless, meaningless mess -- his new existence.  41.

dialogues.speaker: ROY
dialogues.text: Man, I wish I could just live out here forever. Nyles looks over at Roy. A fucked up, sad man who seems t at peace right now.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Follow me. Nyles gets up and slides down the boulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nyles and Roy stand before the CAVE. A quiet wind inside.

dialogues.speaker: ROY
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Your ancestors are in there.

dialogues.speaker: ROY
dialogues.text: My ancestors?

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Your answers. The answers you’re looking for.

dialogues.speaker: ROY
dialogues.text: Alright. I’m in. Nyles wobbles, dizzy, while watching Roy walk in through blurred vision. Nyles’ legs give out and he collapses ont his back, the toll of their binge catching up with him.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Roy... Wait... Nyles dies. Roy continues forth -- then vanishes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah throws darts as Nyles continues.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: That was a mistake. Once Roy learned about his new life, he didn't take it lightly. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: NYLES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Luckily he lives out in Irvine and wakes up there every day, so he only comes around every few... days? weeks? My concept of time is fuzzy.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: What does he want?

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: You got a taste the other night. I think he thinks it’s revenge?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A shirtless, sweaty Roy cracks a whip as he SCREAMS at Ny gagged and tied to a chair under a single swinging lightb

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nyles stares ahead, reflecting on the memory.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: He may have some anger issues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roy waterboards Nyles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fully naked Nyles sprints for his life through the dese running zig zag patterns... He looks back, and UP: An ARR flies through the air -- hits his shoulder, takes him dow

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The darts game is over. Now both Sarah and Darla listen attentively to Nyles’ story.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: He even stopped for a while. I thought I was safe. I settled back into a routine. I felt good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IN SLOW MOTION: Nyles does a cannonball into the pool.  43.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: But then he hit me where it hurt. Nyles surfaces with a gasp, spitting up water --

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: What the fuck’s that smell1?? (looking around) Jerry? But he’s not there. Nyles SNIFFS again, then --

dialogues.speaker: ROY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: How’s the water? Roy walks up smoking a cigar, holding an empty gas can.

dialogues.speaker: ROY
dialogues.text: Looks a little cold. Before Nyles can react, Roy tosses his cigar in the pool, engulfing Nyles in flames. Roy, fire reflected in his eyes, just watches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nyles shoots back a shot of tequila, numbing his PTSD.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: So I vowed to never bring anyone else into this life again. Not everyone is cut out for it.

dialogues.speaker: DARLA
dialogues.text: Amen to that. I tied my tubes at forty. Despite his nonchalance, Sarah senses Nyles is still trou

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: You need to confront him. You can’t keep running from this guy forever.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: What’re you talking about, yeah I can! Nyles gets up and opens the door, the desert sun floods i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hole-in-the-wall taco stand. Nyles and Sarah finish up burritos. A MEXICAN BOY, 8, walks up with a box of candy.

dialogues.speaker: BOY
dialogues.text: Chocolate? For charity... Nyles takes $100 out of his wallet and hands it to the ki The kid’s eyes go wide. Nyles speaks to the kid in Spanis

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: One Kit Kat, a Snickers... (to Sarah) What candy do you like?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Twix.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Good choice. (to the boy) One Twix. Keep the change, friend. And make sure you spend it all today. Buy flowers for that girl Ignacia you have a crush on.

dialogues.speaker: BOY
dialogues.text: Thank you! The boy walks off, staring at the money.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: You know that’s a scam. Notice how he didn’t say which charity? Nyles turns to the kid, now selling to another table.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: What’s the name of your charity? The boy turns, panics, then sprints down the road.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: I know there’s no charity. I give back when I can. I have no interest in material matters. Sarah watches in disgust as he douses his burrito with ho sauce, then takes a huge bite.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Other than beers, burritos, designer drugs, and candy.  45.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: (chewing through) Obviously. I’m not a Puritan.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: What about sex?

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: I’m not not into sex. But it’s been in a steady decline.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Because Misty’s cheating on you?

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Nah, I don’t care about that. We have sex all the time. But no matter how you feel about someone, physically or emotionally, the novelty is bound to fade. Sarah studies him. Is he being serious? Hard to tell.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: But to have to live with that over and over again, to experience that level of betrayal every day, that might really fuck a person up. Nyles studies her.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Yeahhh, but it’d be pretty pathetic of me to hold a grudge. Nyles finishes off his beer. Sarah reaches under the tabl and grabs two more from the box of Tecate.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: What about fucking other people?

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Oh I have. It just takes a lot of work and I put very little effort into my life. A thought strikes Sarah.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: We've never had sex, right?  EXT. 46.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: No. At least not that I recall. Memory is another thing that fades with time, but that may also just be alcoholism.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Yeah, you said that already.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: See my point?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Okay... Who, then? Besides Misty. Just curious.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Daisy. The barkeep.

dialogues.speaker: DESERT
dialogues.text: Nyles lies on a boulder while Daisy rides him, berating h EXT. INT.

dialogues.speaker: DAISY
dialogues.text: You are a prop. You are my little fucking dildo.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Oh my goodness.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I can see that. Who else?

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Darla.

dialogues.speaker: FLASH TO
dialogues.text: DARLA’S TRAILER - BEDROOM - NIGHT Nyles and Darla lie on the bed, caressing each other. She grabs his head and brings it to her bosom.

dialogues.speaker: DARLA
dialogues.text: You make me feel illegal. Nyles kisses her belly tenderly... He looks at her and lo eyes. He nods. She guides him down further, between her l

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: I need to be put in my place sometimes. But it’s great because I always get to wake up alone. Or, ya know, emotionally.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: That’s something an asshole says.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Guess I have no choice but to be an asshole. Nyles takes another bite of his burrito.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: What about Tala?

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: HA. No. Tala actually is a Puritan. But I have tried.

dialogues.text: Tala and Abe slow dance, gazing into each other’s eyes. Nyles, dressed in a tux, taps on Abe’s shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Ahem. May I cut in?

dialogues.speaker: ABE
dialogues.text: It’s the first dance. REVEAL: All of the guests watch. It is indeed the first d

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Please. The one dance. And possibly some over-the-clothes stuff.

dialogues.speaker: TALA
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Yeah. That’s Tala. Anyone else?

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Jerry.  48.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: You fucked Jerry Schlieffen?

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: He fucked me. Off Sarah’s bewildered look --

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: He stuck his penis in my butthole--

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Yeah, I got it.

dialogues.speaker: FLASH TO
dialogues.text: NYLES FACE -- He looks nervous...

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: I’m ready... He WINCES as he’s penetrated. But after a moment, he sett into it, nodding. He looks back to Jerry --

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: You know, it’s not that bad.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: I'm glad I tried it. Turns out I’m not really into dudes. Nyles gathers their burrito wrappers and tosses each of t over his shoulder across the patio, directly into the tra

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: That’s it?

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Yeah. (then) Oh, and your dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IN A HOT TUB: Nyles and Howard are forehead-to-forehead -

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: What are we doing?

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: I don’t know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howard goes in for the kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah processes, confused. Nyles stares back. For a long

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Okay, fine, that one didn’t happen. (continuing casually) What about you? Solid sex life?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I’m not going to fuck you, so don’t even try. Maybe would have the other night. Not now, though.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Girl, I was thinking the same thing. Sarah squints, studying him...

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: You promise we’ve never hooked up?

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Again, my memory is shot, but I don’t think so. (looking up at the sun) Party’s about to start. Head back?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Uh. No. Why would I do that?

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Eat, drink, dance. Bask in looove.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: That’s not love.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Sure it is! Tala’s in love.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: HA! For someone who knows everything, you really have no idea what you're talking about. Nyles sees he struck a bad chord there.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Tala and Abe are like 95% of all couples. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: SARAH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They hit the point in their relationship where they got bored, but are so emotionally stunted they can’t be alone. So, they fall victim to the most archaic patriarchal scam of all time: marriage. Weddings: An industry designed to turn you against the one you ‘love.’ Nyles tries to chime in, but Sarah gets passionate --

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: How any woman with an ounce of self respect is okay spending tens of thousands of dollars so their father can ‘give them away,’ AND calls it the fucking high point of their life... it’s one of society's greatest tragedies. Nyles opens his mouth again, but --

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Why, when anyone tries to simply start a dialogue is it always suppressed? Because we, you and me and everyone, are weak. We can’t stand the idea of being alone, so we buy into the pageantry and celebrate its bullshit. A long beat.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: And the other 5% of couples?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: They have a relaxed no-frills celebration without any friends or family, just free booze and their own mutual respect. They party like it’s their last night on earth, have incredible sex, and then -- they get divorced. We aren’t built to spend our entire lives with another person. Nyles sips his beer.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Okay. So, no wedding I guess. What do you want to do?  51. Sarah sits back, moving on.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Maybe it’s a karma thing?

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: What is?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Maybe that’s how I get out of this. Be selfless and you’re free.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: I just bought you a hundred dollar Twix, and I’m still here.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: No, real acts of selflessness. The bone marrow shit Tala does. She looks around at the various people at the taco stand.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Maybe life goes on for everyone else here, just not us, until we've earned our way out. So, tomorrow, that kid will still have a hundred bucks to spend.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: And there’s a world where Tala is missing her teeth.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: But there are millions of worlds where she isn’t. Have you really never thought of this before? Of course he has. Still, he humors her --

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Okay. Maybe you’re right. Then what is the most selfless act you could do? Something that would absolutely guarantee an end to this day. Sarah thinks for a brief second. She knows what to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRIBAL MUSIC begins and the guests quiet down for the ceremony. Two DANCERS in green leotards dance down the ai weaving between hay bales, tossing glitter on guests. From here we catch brief snapshots of the wedding: - Abe and his MOM stroll down the aisle to CHEERS. - The WEDDING PARTY walks down... Misty and Trevor, Erin Nico, Sarah and Randy. Nyles gives her two thumbs up. EVERYONE STANDS to watch Tala walk with Howard. As Tala a Abe meet at the altar, their faces stretch into the great smile of their lives. Abe’s eyes well up, Tala starts cry The Officiant wipes a tear. Howard sobs, Pia comforts him pan the audience: EVERYONE feels the love. And then there’s Sarah. She steps forward --

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Hold up! Puzzled looks fill the crowd. Nyles, too. At this point h has no idea what her “selfless act” actually is.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: What are you doing? Sarah ignores him and takes the mic from The Officiant. She holds it up to her mouth, words on the tip of her tongue... but looking out at audience, and then to Tala.. she reconsiders, and lowers the mic. She walks up to Tala, pulls her into a tight hug and says something inaudible into her ear. The onlooking crowd wai

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: (quietly to Nyles) What is she doing? Nyles shrugs. No clue. Sarah releases the hug, tears fill her eyes. She hands th mic to The Officiant, the flowers to Pia, and walks away. Everyone turns to Tala for an explanation. She’s in shock Speechless. She looks at her parents, a silent cry for he At Abe. At everyone. Heavy breathing, the world is ending

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EVERYBODY PANICS. Pia holds Tala. Howard holds the altar steady. One guest sprints away. A baby cries. Nyles remains calm, but confused -- THE EARTHQUAKE STOPS. The guests glance around with relie

dialogues.speaker: THE OFFICIANT
dialogues.text: Look at that. The gods have spoken and they approve this marriage! But Tala is now SOBBING into Pia’s shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah’s far more relaxed, with an almost celebratory vibe she takes shots and plays pool with a couple barflies. The front door swings open, Nyles steps in --

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: What the hell did you say to her?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Doesn't matter, sister stuff. But I think I’m good. Karma’s fucking great. Selflessness is fantastic. Sarah hits two balls in at once.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Pay up boys. The barflies she was playing each hand her $20.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: (to the Ted the Bartender) Two shots of your finest whiskey. Ted pours the shots. Sarah holds one out for Nyles --

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Well, Nyles, it’s been great. Or, interesting, at least. If this ever happens again, please keep me out of the cave. Good luck with the psychopath. Deal with him. Maybe that’s your way out. They clink their glasses and take the shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. NYLES’ AND MISTY’S BEDROOM - MORNING Nyles sleeps in bed. Just another day. Someone POUNDING o the door. Misty wraps a towel around her body --

dialogues.speaker: MISTY
dialogues.text: Hold on, I’m coming! She unlocks it and Sarah barges in, straight to Nyles --

dialogues.speaker: MISTY
dialogues.text: What the hell, Sarah? Nyles jolts up.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Didn't work. Life is meaningless. Let’s get the fuck out of here. She heads out. Misty looks at Nyles as he rolls out of be

dialogues.speaker: MISTY
dialogues.text: Are you -- Nyles jumps in --

dialogues.speaker: NYLES MISTY
dialogues.text: -- fucking cheating on me? -- fucking cheating on me? Nyles pulls on his swim trunks --

dialogues.speaker: NYLES / MISTY
dialogues.text: (in unison) What? ... This isn’t funny. Nyles puts on his Hawaiian shirt, Misty is freaking out -

dialogues.speaker: NYLES / MISTY
dialogues.text: Okay, stop... I’m serious... Don’t copy me... Stop pretending like you know everything... I hate, agh -- And this back and forth takes us into --

dialogues.speaker: A SERIES, THE DAYS AND NIGHTS OF NYLES AND SARAH
dialogues.text: CONGA + SYNTH DANCE GROOVES OF ALEX CAMERON’S “THE CHIHUA I/E. - SARAH’S CAR/HIGHWAY - DAY Sarah speeds down the open road, her hair blowing in the wind, Nyles stands out her sunroof with a beer.  55.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HIP POOL PARTY alive with dancing, cornhole, bocce ball and a photo booth. And in the middle of it all: Nyles and Sarah float in the pool with neon cocktails.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah wakes up. Glances at the bathroom, shower running. weight of the real world returns. She fights through -- NYLES AND MISTY’S BEDROOM Nyles wakes up and jumps out of bed with pep in his step.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BULLET STRIKES FIDEL CASTRO (on a poster/target) in the forehead, blowing out cloud of dust and hay -- Nyles lowers his sniper rifle, smoke swirls from the barr

dialogues.text: Kill shot. Sarah steps up with an AK-47 and scans the targets. Castr Osama Bin Laden, and some guy with a handlebar mustache.

dialogues.text: Who’s the mustache? SPUDS (50), the owner, stands by with a bazooka. A GOAT grazes in a PEN behind him.

dialogues.text: How’d you get such a good picture?

dialogues.text: Facebook. SARAH FIRES -- DESTROYING THE MUSTACHE MAN’S HEAD. I/E. SARAH’S CAR/HIGHWAY - DAY Nyles drives, Sarah surfs on top of the car. Nyles hits a POTHOLE and SARAH FALLS OFF --

dialogues.text: Sarah wakes up, morning dread --  56.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah (not dressed for the wedding) walks to the edge of dance floor. Randy drunkenly dances up to her.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: What up, Sarah? We missed you earlier. Tala’s pissed.

dialogues.text: What? Sarah leans in to his ear --

dialogues.text: Randy is naked, blindfolded by his shirt, holding his iPh out to record. He takes a deep breath, then opens the doo REVEAL: Trevor going down on Misty --

dialogues.speaker: MISTY
dialogues.text: Randy! Fuck! And just behind them we see Nyles and Sarah watching the scene through the bathroom window, loving it.

dialogues.text: Sarah’s car -- fifty yards up -- EXPLODES! Sarah, Nyles, and Spuds pop up from a DITCH, high-fiving. Nyles points to Sarah’s ears -- they’re bleeding -- but s LAUGHS about it.  57.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nyles tries setting up a tent but can’t because Sarah kee WHIPPING him with one of the poles, really fucking hard.

dialogues.text: Nyles and Sarah lie in their own sleeping bags, facing aw from each other.

dialogues.text: Sarah wakes up, looks at the empty space next to her in b NYLES AND MISTY’S BEDROOM Nyles wakes up, looks at the empty space next to him in b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abe and Tala are about to cut the cake when Nyles runs up CROSSBOW in hand --

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Don’t! There’s a bomb in the cake! Nyles DIGS into the cake, GASPS throughout the crowd, and finds a BRICK OF C4.

dialogues.speaker: PIA
dialogues.text: Oh my god!

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: It’s okay, I used to be a bomb guy. Nyles takes an arrow and STABS it into the C4, cocks the crossbow, and FIRES it into the air -- It EXPLODES above the party, a bizarrely beautiful firewo display, interrupted by -- SARAH, riding up on a motorcycle. She stops by the pool.

dialogues.speaker: TREVOR
dialogues.text: Hey, that’s my motorcycle --

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: (to Nyles) You son of a bitch! You ruined my plan to kill everyone!

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Sarah! The sister of the bride! I should’ve known it was you! (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: NYLES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (then) Howard, I’1l take her alive, if it’s the last thing I do.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: Son, please, put the weapon down -- Sarah TACKLES Nyles into the pool --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
