dialogues.text: Nyles (helmet and goggles on) feigns a confident smile an thumbs up to Sarah as he’s led to the open door by his ta skydiving INSTRUCTOR -- Sarah pushes by and leaps OUT of the plane, without her parachute, turning back at Nyles with two middle fingers

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wide shot, brutal sun, clear blue sky, A FIGURE rockets TOWARD the Earth -- it’s SARAH -- in FREEFALL, dive-bombi THUMP!!! A mini mushroom cloud where she hits the ground.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE GROUND
dialogues.text: Nyles and the instructor hurry out of the prop plane -- N laughs maniacally while the instructor frantically sprint Sarah’s body. The instructor checks her pulse, then looks to Nyles, still laughing as he marches INTO THE PROPELLER INT. CALMADA ESTATE - NYLES AND MISTY’S BEDROOM - MORNING Nyles wakes up, looks at the empty space next to him in b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah wakes up, looks at the empty space next to her in b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nyles, giddy with excitement, leads a blindfolded Sarah i the bar... He takes off her blindfold to REVEAL: The entire bar is filled with decorations -- STREAMERS, BALLOONS, and giant ‘HAPPY MILLIONTH BIRTHDAY, SARAH’ sig The unenthused BARFLIES all wear PARTY HATS, Darla claps Sarah covers her smile, truly touched and surprised --  59.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Have I really been here that long?

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: You’re asking the wrong guy -- Nyles lifts up a CONFETTI CANNON and blasts her face --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nyles, Sarah, and five other DESERT HIPSTERS party -- drinking, dancing, snorting blow. A couple of them make o

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: Everyone is passed out. Four packed on the bed, including Sarah, eyes closed, nuzzling into Nyles’ arm. ON NYLES’ FACE, watching Sarah fall asleep, weighing something in his head... He drifts to sleep. INT. NYLES AND MISTY’S BEDROOM - MORNING Nyles opens his eyes. An empty space next to him, as alwa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: END MONTAGE ON: Sarah and Nyles drive away from us down a dirt road deep in the desert...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nyles and Sarah sit by a small fire, empty desert vista behind them. Sarah holds a cheeseburger. Nyles chews a Tw

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Think of it like this -- Nyles holds up his half-eaten Twix and gestures to the ar that’s gone.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Everything in this void here, where the Twix once was but is now in my stomach, is the past. He gestures to the remainder of the Twix bar --

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: And everything that’s left to eat is the future, encased in chocolate. Sarah keeps listening... Nyles gestures to the void again  60.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: None of this concerns me. The who, what, why of your past. You got here, that’s all that matters. You ate some Twix and pooped it out. No need to sift through the shit.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: But if you really want to know someone deeper, it does matter. You have to know the whole package.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Packages suck. Does what you said to Tala at the altar concern me? Nah. All that matters is it convinced you to let it go. This -- He shows his next bite -- layers of crunchy cookie, caram

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: -- the next bite is all that matters. (takes another bite) Devote all of your energy to what’s happening in this precise moment. (another bite) Now. And again -- (another bite, chewing) Passing.. Now... With every ‘Now,’ Nyles watches an imaginary figure drift away - from the Twix - off into the distance. Sarah stares back at him, unimpressed.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I was married for two years.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: You don’t need to tell me about that.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I still am, technically. Divorce takes a while. (then) My family hated him. My dad's the kind of guy who desperately tries to see the good in everyone, and even he hated the guy.  61.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Good thing none of that matters anymore. Sarah ignores Nyles’ attempt to keep her from opening up.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I knew it wasn’t going to work out when I said ‘yes,’ I knew it wasn’t going to work out when I moved to Austin for him, I knew it wasn’t going to work out as I walked down the aisle. But I went through with it. And it didn’t work out. And ignoring all of that would make me destined to repeat it. Nyles stares in the middle distance as his chewing slows. Like he’s short circuiting. Silence. For a long time.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: These are fantastic mushrooms. Sarah stares at her burger. It’s so juicy... Nyles digs through his memory... it’s fading fast... then snaps back into it, momentarily --

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: You could be dead tomorrow...

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Except I can’t be dead tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: But if you could, all that energy spent focusing on the past and future will have been wasted... Energy is everything. Energy is...

dialogues.speaker: SARAH NYLES
dialogues.text: Everything. Everything. Sarah processes... Losing her grip... She puts up a finge hold on. She walks behind some bushes and pukes 0.S., the returns, wiping her mouth. Reengaged --

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: What if I want to invest some present energy into my future? Like my burger. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: SARAH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I have maybe one bite in me, but I also know the center is going to be the tastiest part. So what if I go straight for the center and skip the edges.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Don’t ever skip the edges.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I hate the edges.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: I feel sorry for you then. A beat. Sarah begins to smile...

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: If you feel sorry for me, that Means you care about me, Nyles.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: (deflecting) When I say “I feel sorry,” it’s in the same way that I feel slightly annoyed when I finish a beer and need to open a new one. (he opens another beer) It’s a fleeting feeling. It drifts away, like everything else. Nyles watches the imaginary ‘It’ drift away. Sarah studie him as he sips his beer...

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: What else has drifted away? Nyles goes silent, his thoughts take him somewhere else.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Nyles?

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Everything. (smiling, holding up his beer) Cheers. He’s burying something, but she’s not in the right headsp to push him further.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: To pretending not to care.  63.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: To pretending -- Nyles FREEZES, drops his beer, eyes wide, staring at something in the distance. A child-like grin takes shape he’s fully entranced by what he’s looking at. Sarah turns her head to see -- MILES AWAY: SILHOUETTES TRAVERSING THE SUNSET. DINOSAURS. BRONTOSAURUS MOTHER LEADS HER TWO SMALLER DINO CUBS. Sarah's face glows with pure joy.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Oh my god.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: You see them, too?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Are they real?

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Who cares? As they watch the dinosaurs, Sarah moves to the other sid the fire and sits down next to Nyles.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: They're beautiful. She smiles and grabs Nyles’ hand. He squeezes back. THE EARTHQUAKE HITS -- but Nyles and Sarah don’t react. They're locked onto the dinosaurs. Off this tableau --

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: Nyles pisses on the fire to extinguish it. The light of t lantern shines through the tent behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nyles crawls into his sleeping bag. Sarah’s still awake.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Au revoir, mi amigo. Nyles shuts his eyes. Sarah watches him drift into sleep.  64.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Nyles.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Mmmhmm. . .

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Let’s just get it over with and fuck.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: (caught off guard) Okay. Sarah straddles him and starts kissing him, taking charge She takes off his shirt. Then her own. As she goes back i

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Wait.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: What? Nyles, though drunk and still coming down from the mushro is quite taken by Sarah, by her body, by the whole situat It’s intense and real and complicated. To the point where Sarah feels uncomfortable by the vulnerability. So -- She skirts past it, pulls him toward her, and they go at

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Locked on the tent, the lantern casts shadows, subtle moa merge with the desert sounds -- creaking insects, the smoldering fire, a coyote’s howl. We MOVE AWAY from the t through the smoke of the fire, and float UP -- Off the plateau, drifting into the night, moving on from moment... And now the tent is merely a spec, a dot of lig in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But her face wears conflicted emotions, more like a bad hangover than the post-coital elation one might expect. S considers sitting up, but it’s all too heavy for her righ now. She gives up and lies there, listening to the shower  65.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah walks through the house to wake up Nyles, but she s at the BRIDAL SUITE. The door is ajar. She peeks INSIDE: Tala sips on a mimosa while Erin does her hair, both smil Sarah watches, longing for this happiness she can never s with her sister. PRE-LAP: The sound of a beer can opening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah sips her beer, driving. In the passenger seat, Nyle has a fresh glow and a twinkle in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: I gotta say, I felt different this morning. Like... goooooood. In a good way though, ya know? Sarah's off in another world.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Because of last night?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Oh. Yeah. She glances in the rearview mirror, noticing a dark car a ways back. Is this guy following her?

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Is that a “Yeah” of regret? Or...?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Yeah, it was fun. Tension relief. It’s fun to relieve tension. She's still looking at this car. It’s a little closer now Close enough to see that it’s a POLICE CAR. Nyles doesn’t notice, more concerned by her response.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Should we talk about it?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: What’s to talk about, it’s all meaningless, and technically that happened tonight.  66. Nyles sits back, put off by the cold turn she’s taken. Sarah throws her beer out the window, and checks the mirr for the cop’s reaction.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: So we’re littering now?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: (re: the cop) Nothing still, Jesus. This cop’s been following us for miles. What's this fucker’s deal? Sarah presses the gas to pick up speed. 90mph and climbin

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Are you trying to get pulled over? ON NYLES... thinking... he turns around and squints at th cop car, still following at the same distance. Nyles seem be piecing something together in his head... 100mph. The cop turns the sirens on.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Finally! Sarah starts slowing down.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Believe it or not I’ve never been arrested before. Curious to see what it’s all about. Nyles looks back one more time. His eyes go wide.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: No. Dead serious, he slouches in his seat, out of view.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: I think it’s him.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Him?

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Roy.  67.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Oh! That fucker. Sarah screeches to a halt. The cop car stops right behind only see the cop’s silhouette, his sheriff’s hat...

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Keep driving.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: No way. If you aren’t going to deal with him, someone has to. Sarah gets out of the car and throws her arms up --

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Help! He’s trying to kill me! Sarah runs back toward the cop car as Nyles sinks deeper his seat -- what the hell is she doing? NYLES’ POV: Sarah reaches the cop car, frantically shouti

dialogues.speaker: COP'S VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (on the microphone) Sir, step out of the vehicle! Nyles freezes. Maybe it isn’t Roy. Now what?

dialogues.speaker: COP'S VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (on the microphone) If you don’t step out, I have no choice but to remove you by force. Nyles peeks back again: the cop slowly approaches Sarah’s car. Still backlit, but it doesn’t look like Roy. This gu has a mustache. Nyles breathes a sigh of relief.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Okay! I’m coming out! Nyles opens the door, puts his hands up, still holding hi beer, and slowly stands, his back to the officer.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Sorry Mr. Policeman, I thought you were someone else.

dialogues.speaker: COP
dialogues.text: Oh yeah, who’s that? Nyles turns and locks eyes with the cop, who’s now at the trunk of Sarah’s car... And Nyles’ relief drains.  68. It’s Roy, wearing a huge grin -- and a fake mustache.

dialogues.speaker: ROY
dialogues.text: Howdy, stranger. Roy raises a SHOTGUN --

dialogues.speaker: PINNING HIM BETWEEN THE TWO VEHICLES.
dialogues.text: ON SARAH, surprised by the mix of pleasure and horror she feeling. She shakes off those thoughts, backs the cop car Roy collapses, broken in half, held together by skin.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: (on the microphone) You called for back up? Nyles stares at Roy twitching on the ground, gasping for BWOOP BWOOP -- Sarah messes with the cop car sounds.

dialogues.speaker: ROY
dialogues.text: -.. Who... is that? Nyles shakes his head, conflicted. This asshole’s caused so much pain, but it’s hard to watch someone die. BWOOP BWOOP.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: (on the microphone) Please step inside my vehicle, sir. As Roy wheezes, Nyles steps back to the cop car, maintain eye contact with Roy the whole way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nyles chugs beer in the passenger seat, dazed, even remorseful, but trying to stay composed while Sarah drive

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Lighten up, dude. Look what he was planning to use on you. Sarah gestures to the backseat where there’s an aquarium a COBRA SNAKE. It hisses, spitting venom against the glas

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Let’s do something crazy.  Nyles looks around at their stolen cop car.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Isn't this crazy?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Let’s rob a gas station. Ooh, what about a bank? Nyles doesn’t share in her excitement.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: What’s with the sudden blood lust?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: It’s not blood lust. It’s about trying something new.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: You just killed a guy.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Yeah, a fucking sadist, dude. You've had forever to play around in this world but I haven’t. You can’t expect me to take your word for everything.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: What about the karma?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Yeah, I don’t believe in that anymore.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: (disappointed) Oh. Really?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Of course not. That’s what you’ve been telling me from day one. “The only way to live is to embrace the fact that nothing matters.” Right? So I’m embracing it. 69. Nyles sits back. She’s right. But he doesn’t want to admi it. He glances out the window, searching for an answer, a distraction, and notices a BILLBOARD for a local casino.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: What about the casino?  70.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Ooo, good call. That’s even better than a bank.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: I don’t mean rob the place. Being a source of terror isn’t fun and isn’t fulfilling. It doesn’t matter that everything resets and people forget. WE have to live with what we do. I draw a line at cruelty.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: For a guy who supposedly cares about nothing, you seem to have a lot of lines you won't cross. Nyles drinks his beer, done debating this.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Whatever, fine. We’ll go to the casino and not rob it. (then) Pussy.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Thank you. Nyles raises his beer in cheers -- as Sarah stomps on the and accelerates down the highway --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah slams her hands down on a half-full BLACKJACK table she takes a seat. Nyles sits beside her --

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: (to the DEALER) I’m gonna count cards. Cool?

dialogues.speaker: DEALER
dialogues.text: Please don’t. The Dealer starts dealing out the next hand. Sarah counts cards out loud, albeit completely incorrectly.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: King, nine, ace, three. Nyles, wanna jump in here? Nyles lightens up, glad to get back to the innocuous fun  71.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Sure thing. Three, four, three. Lot of threes. A GRUMPY PLAYER groans, then takes a bite of his HOT DOG. Sarah adds a few $100 BLACK CHIPS to her bet --

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Bold move, I dig it.

dialogues.speaker: DEALER
dialogues.text: You can’t bet during your hand.

dialogues.speaker: GRUMPY PLAYER
dialogues.text: These fucking kids --

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Don’t call me a fucking kid. I didn’t know I couldn’t bet more. (to Dealer) Apologies. Sarah kisses her fingertips and makes a peace sign -- and rotates into a middle finger aimed at the Grumpy Player. Nyles clocks this as the Dealer looks at him for his turn

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: I’ll stay... Sarah’s turn, but she’s still shooting angry eyes at the Grumpy Player. He stares back at her, dead-eyed.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I want more.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: You already have nineteen.

dialogues.speaker: GRUMPY PLAYER
dialogues.text: You don’t want to hit, sweetheart.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Don’t tell me what to fucking do. (to Dealer) Hit me. Hard. The Dealer lays down a QUEEN on her TEN/NINE. BUST.

dialogues.speaker: GRUMPY PLAYER
dialogues.text: You took my card, bitch.  72.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES SARAH
dialogues.text: Hey! That’s not nice! The fuck did you call me?

dialogues.speaker: GRUMPY PLAYER
dialogues.text: Screw you two, fucking amateurs. This isn’t daycare. Sarah gets in his face as Nyles tries holding her back --

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Oh suck my dick you greasy fucking hot dog man.

dialogues.speaker: GRUMPY PLAYER
dialogues.text: (to Nyles) You should keep a tighter leash on your girlfriend and her nasty mouth --

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Hey! Screw you, dude --

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I’m not his girlfriend -- Nyles shoots her an surprised look -- Sarah KNEES the Grumpy Player in the nuts, grabs all of h chips and bolts for the door --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah bursts through the doors, giggling and delirious, followed by an exasperated Nyles, the Security Guards and Grumpy Man now in pursuit.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: What the hell is going on with you?!

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: That guy had it coming to him. You're supposed to be on my side!

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: I was on your side! Nyles is losing steam -- then -- a SECURITY GUARD in a go cart speeds up beside them --

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY GUARD
dialogues.text: Freeze, asshole! Sarah THROWS her CHIPS at his face, causing him to swerve  73. Nyles and Sarah keep running -- almost to the car --

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: (to the Guard) It’s not worth it, man! Back off -- The Security Guard FIRES HIS TASER into Nyles’ neck -- Ny YELPS and tumbles onto the asphalt, writhing.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: A COP sits a handcuffed Nyles on the curb beside Sarah, a handcuffed. Nyles’ face is scraped and bloodied from the fall. Sarah seems... excited. Almost manic.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Not quite what I had in mind, but glad we did it, ya know? This world is too small for dicks like that. She gestures to the Grumpy Player giving his statement to cops. But Nyles looks at her, blank-faced. We now see his right eyeball is completely red and draining bloody tears

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: You're a fucking lunatic.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Oh shut up. No one got “harmed.”

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: I DID. I’m crying blood. Sarah chuckles, but Nyles is really pissed.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: You’1l be fine tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: PAIN IS REAL. Why can’t you understand that?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: It doesn’t matter. Nothing matters. Those are your words.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Pain matters! What we do to other people matters! We were having fun. Then you killed Roy.  74.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: You were never going to deal with him. I did you a favor. So, fuck you.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: No, Sarah fuck you. You act like a child, which is exactly what led to you being stuck in this shit in the first place. This strikes a nerve with Sarah. So, she KICKS him. A beat...

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Ow! See?! A child!

dialogues.speaker: COP
dialogues.text: Knock it off, over there!

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I’m stuck in this shit because YOU got me stuck in it.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: HA! I told you to stop, but nope, can’t tell you what to do because you've got it all figured out.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I followed you because I liked you and someone was trying to hurt you. Because I GIVE A SHIT, which you clearly know nothing about. But had I known I’d be stuck with a pretentious, wannabe nihilist for the rest of my fucking life I'd have stayed far away, and I sure as hell would never have slept with you.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Oh please, we've fucked a thousand times.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: What do you mean? Nyles looks to the Cops --

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Can you move this along, guys?  75.

dialogues.speaker: COP
dialogues.text: Shut up!

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Answer me. Nyles looks at her with a cold stare --

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: I lied. Yes, we've hooked up. So many times. All I had to do was bail you out with that ridiculous speech at the wedding. That easy. And it was always nice because I never had to deal with it the next day. But now I do. They stare at each other for a moment, letting it all sin in. Sarah’s lip begins to quiver, but she fights it back.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: I’m an awful person, whatever, but you're that predictable. She turns away. Nyles does the same.

dialogues.speaker: MISTY, (PRE-LAP)
dialogues.text: Wake up. INT. NYLES’ AND MISTY’S BEDROOM - THE NEXT MORNING Nyles wakes up in bed. Another day. Misty moisturizes. Sh glances at him, expecting a comment. But he offers nothin He looks at the door, waiting for Sarah's knock. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nyles drinks on his pizza, but he can’t get comfortable. sun is too bright, the beer too warm, the pizza isn’t inflated enough. Everything is off. Sarah is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nyles pours himself a tall glass of tequila while Howard Pia chat nearby.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: She didn’t leave a note or anything? Are you sure she didn’t text back?  76.

dialogues.speaker: PIA
dialogues.text: Check my phone if you don’t believe me. Sarah realized the day wasn’t about her so she left.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: Don’t say that.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: No, Pia’s right. Howard and Pia look over at him. Who is this guy? Nyles d his tequila and walks off with the bottle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nyles lies on a hay bale, drinking by himself, watching t wedding reception unfold, Misty and Trevor flirting by th bar. He shifts his gaze up to the sky, to the stars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nyles stands before the cave. He turns around and scans t desert, one final check. He downs a bottle of wine, shatt it against a rock, then walks into the cave.

dialogues.speaker: MISTY, (PRE-LAP)
dialogues.text: Wake up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nyles wanders down the hall in his underwear, passing peo setting up for the wedding. He stops in the living room w he sees Pia putting up photos of Tala and Abe.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Pia, what room is Sarah staying in? Pia turns, she doesn’t recognize this odd man.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Misty’s boyfriend, come on.

dialogues.speaker: PIA
dialogues.text: (playing it off) Oh. Yeah, of course. Her room is the second to last down the hall. (as Nyles turns) But she isn’t there.  77.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Where is she?

dialogues.speaker: PIA
dialogues.text: No one knows, we haven’t seen her since last night. Howard went to wake her up this morning but she wasn’t in there. Nyles walks down the hall, second to last room, and opens It’s empty. The bed perfectly made, untouched.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: What the fuck? He walks back to the living room. Howard, The Officiant, Randy are all there now...

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Did anyone actually see her stay in there last night? Pia cocks her head. The others are just as confused.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: She wakes me up every day, so she has to be somewhere. She has to be. Nyles looks out the front window for Sarah’s car. It’s go Misty steps out, still in her towel, worried that her boyfriend might be having a breakdown.

dialogues.speaker: MISTY
dialogues.text: What are you doing, Nyles? Nyles stares back at the onlookers. Maybe he’s lost his m

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nyles zones out on the bed amidst an intimate cocaine par with Randy, The Officiant, and Jerry. An alt-country reco plays. The Officiant cuts the coke on the mirrored coffee table and rambles about the record:

dialogues.speaker: THE OFFICIANT
dialogues.text: Frederick Dougless, spelled L-E-S-S instead of L-A-S-S like the slave.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: But he’s white?  78.

dialogues.speaker: THE OFFICIANT
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: That seems fucked up.

dialogues.speaker: THE OFFICIANT
dialogues.text: No, man, it’s a commentary. He’s the second coming of Gram Parsons. Abe enters --

dialogues.speaker: RANDY THE OFFICIANT
dialogues.text: Ayyy! Married man! There’s the fuckin’ guy!

dialogues.speaker: ABE
dialogues.text: Mind if I partake? Need a breather. Abe snorts a line off the coffee table. He notices Nyles

dialogues.speaker: ABE
dialogues.text: Misty’s boyfriend, right? Maybe don't mention this to her, cuz it’ll be a thing. Nyles zips his lips shut, locks them, and throws the key. frequently cut back to Nyles as the coke babble accelerat

dialogues.speaker: THE OFFICIANT
dialogues.text: (to Abe) Remember when Frederick Dougless opened for me at the Bootleg. The Officiant does a line.

dialogues.speaker: ABE
dialogues.text: The next Gram Parsons.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: Who is this Gram Parsons? Abe, Randy, and the Officiant all look over, judging him. Nyles lies back, his head on the pillow, staring up.

dialogues.speaker: THE OFFICIANT
dialogues.text: Flying Burrito Brothers? The Byrds?

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: I’m from Sudan, dude. (off their looks) Of course I know the fucking Byrds.  79.

dialogues.speaker: THE OFFICIANT
dialogues.text: Well, Gram Parsons was in The Byrds for their best record --

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: -- Sweetheart of the Rodeo.

dialogues.speaker: THE OFFICIANT
dialogues.text: And then he moved out here, did a ton of drugs with Keith Richards, wrote his solo albums --

dialogues.speaker: ABE
dialogues.text: -- GP and Grievous Angel.

dialogues.speaker: THE OFFICIANT
dialogues.text: Then he OD‘d, but he practically drank himself to death by then.

dialogues.speaker: ABE
dialogues.text: The dude just couldn’t hang. Abe snorts another line.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: I don’t really like country music. The three guys hang their heads and groan in disappointme Nyles turns to his side, his face sinks into the silk pil

dialogues.speaker: ABE
dialogues.text: (to Nyles, re: coke) Misty’s boyfriend, you in? Nyles doesn’t move... his face changes... something about this pillow. He inhales and recognizes the scent.

dialogues.speaker: ABE
dialogues.text: Whatever. Abe does another line, then heads for the door --

dialogues.speaker: ABE
dialogues.text: Feel free to join the party -- Abe exits. Nyles takes another breath into the pillow -- sits up with some pep. His detective hat is on.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Is it just you two staying in this room?  80.

dialogues.speaker: THE OFFICIANT
dialogues.text: Yeah... Nyles’ suspicious stare bounces between the two guys.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: You okay, dude?

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Were you both here last night, too?

dialogues.speaker: THE OFFICIANT
dialogues.text: Nah, Tala is all serious about the whole no-sleeping-together-before- the-wedding thing, so Abe took it.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Abe slept here last night?

dialogues.speaker: THE OFFICIANT
dialogues.text: Yeah... What’s up? Nyles grabs the pillow and heads outside --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nyles races to the dance floor as Abe sits down next to T

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Abraham, you slick fuck! I get it! Abe turns, confused.

dialogues.speaker: ABE
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: You and Sarah. It all makes sense! Abe’s stomach sinks. Other guests turn to watch...

dialogues.speaker: TALA
dialogues.text: (to Abe) What’s he talking about?

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Your sister and Abraham were boning each other. She spent last night in his room, that’s why no one could find her. She wakes up with him everyday and probably sneaks out in the morning. No wonder she hates herself. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: NYLES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (then) Here, smell this. From Abe’s bed. Nyles tosses Tala the pillow. She holds it, piecing thing together in her head...

dialogues.speaker: ABE
dialogues.text: Shut up, you’re drunk.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: No, you shut up. How did no one notice this before? (then) I mean, it took me a long time. A really long time. Jesus... How did I miss this? Nyles pauses for a moment of self-reflection. He shakes i off just as a pissed-off Misty steps in --

dialogues.speaker: MISTY
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Shut up and go fuck Trevor. Misty’s jaw drops. Tala focuses her attention on --

dialogues.speaker: TALA
dialogues.text: Abe. That isn’t true, is it?

dialogues.speaker: ABE
dialogues.text: Of course not. This guy’s been drunk all day.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: That may be accurate, nevertheless -- (to Tala) If you smell the pillow, you will recognize the distinct scent of Viktor and Rolf Flowerbomb, the hair mist you gave Sarah on her birthday. Quizzical looks all around. Why, and how, would he know t Tala slowly brings the pillow to her nose. It’s Viktor an Rolf Flowerbomb alright.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: (to the crowd) Is there anyone else here who uses Viktor and Rolf Flowerbomb? The crowd is silent. Tala’s face sinks with the realizati  82.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: (to Abe) Never underestimate the scent of a woman.

dialogues.speaker: ABE
dialogues.text: Get the fuck out of here.

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD
dialogues.text: (off Tala’s realization) Abe, let’s take a walk.

dialogues.speaker: ABE
dialogues.text: You don’t actually believe this guy? Abe looks at all the faces judging him. Tala, Howard, Pia the Schlieffens, Trevor, Erin -- all stare at Abe in shoc

dialogues.speaker: ABE
dialogues.text: Come on. Guys, really. That’s not me. But Tala knows it is. It makes sense to her. Time for him leave. Abe begins to walk away... but Nyles won’t let it

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: You sad, pathetic fool.

dialogues.speaker: MISTY
dialogues.text: Nyles.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: (to Abe) You cheated on your fiancé, at your wedding, with her sister...

dialogues.speaker: MISTY
dialogues.text: Stop it, Nyles. Nyles turns to Tala. Her world is falling apart.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: And fuck, Sarah, doing that to you? Even I wouldn’t stoop that low. (turns to the guests) And all of you -- ABE TACKLES NYLES. A FIGHT BREAKS OUT BETWEEN THE TWO. Nyles and Abe sloppily wrestle on the dance floor, Nyles the losing end. Nyles manages to get up, then TACKLES Abe into a table -- place settings and succulents go flying. FACE SLAPS, BITING, KNEES TO THE GUT, SPITTING -——  83. Pinned down, Nyles spots a FORK and reaches for it... His fingers are almost on it... And he gets it -- And STABS ABE IN THE CHEEK WITH THE FORK.

dialogues.speaker: HORRIFIC SCREAMS ALL AROUND --
dialogues.text: Abe gets up in a state of shock. Fork stuck in his face. pulls it out, stares at it. Blood drains from his cheek. Nyles even seems stunned. Abe STABS NYLES IN THE EYE WITH THE FORK. EVERYBODY SCREA

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: ABE'S SMILING FACE, unscathed, as he goes to kiss Tala --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything is back to normal. No mess, no blood, no horro Nyles slouches in his chair at another table, bearing the heavy reality of his world. He refills his glass of wine, spilling over the brim onto the white table cloth. Jerry watches him, concerned. DANCE FLOOR: The Officiant takes the mic.

dialogues.speaker: THE OFFICIANT
dialogues.text: I'd like to invite the mother of the bride up for a little surprise. Pia and her two sisters walk out. Pia takes a breath to compose herself. One of her sisters rubs her back, smilin Tala gives Abe a look: What’s she doing? Abe shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: PIA
dialogues.text: Tala. You know that I’m not great with words. But I do love you more than anything.

dialogues.speaker: TALA
dialogues.text: Love you too, Mom! Nyles watches with dead eyes, nursing his wine.

dialogues.speaker: PIA
dialogues.text: And Abe, the beautiful bridegroom, you are now my son.  84. Tala kisses him. Nyles gives a loose wrist clap.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Great man, great man! Abe notices, but shrugs it off.

dialogues.speaker: PIA
dialogues.text: When I was a little girl, me and my sisters found beauty in music. It’s how we communicated and bonded. Abe rubs Tala’s back. Tala smiles wistfully, missing Sara Nyles watches this and drinks more.

dialogues.speaker: PIA
dialogues.text: So we’re going to perform a song we learned as little girls. It’s a song I want you two to remember when you run into hard times. Love can get you through anything. This is “A Lover’s Concerto.” The Officiant presses play on the laptop, cueing “A Lover Concerto” by The Toys. Pia TRANSFORMS into a whole new person, a true performer, hamming it up with PURE JOY --

dialogues.speaker: PIA
dialogues.text: How gentle is the rain that falls softly on the meadow... Tala’s hands cover her grin, tears welling up. Nyles’ breathing gets heavier. He downs the rest of his w

dialogues.speaker: PIA
dialogues.text: «+. Some magic from above made this day for us just to fall in love... Pia and her sisters do a little choreographed step-and-sh as they sing back ups. The guests all CHEER. Nyles stares off, lost in a thought or memory. And he beg to cry. Some guests notice.

dialogues.speaker: PIA
dialogues.text: .«.. Oh, don't ever make me cry through long lonely nights without us. Be always true to me, keep this day in your heart eternally... Tala grabs Abe’s hand and pulls him up to dance.  85. As the INSTRUMENTAL BREAK in the song hits, the sound of grown man’s GUTTURAL MOANS spread. Heads turn to the sour Nyles is a bawling, blubbering mess. It’s truly an ugly c The backing track of the song continues on, but Pia and h sisters stop singing, joining everyone as they just watch Nyles in bewilderment. At a loss, Tala and Abe look over Misty, by the bar with Trevor, shaking her head, embarras Finally, Jerry puts his hand on Nyles’ shoulder, bends do and whispers into his ear. Nyles nods and rises. Jerry pu his arm around Nyles and leads him away. INT. NYLES AND MISTY’S BEDROOM - NIGHT Nyles and Jerry sit on the bed. Nyles is hunched over, he in his hands, but he’s done crying. Jerry rubs his back.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: It's okay, my friend.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: It’s painful. I don’t get it.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: What is painful? Nyles turns to Jerry, snot dripping from his nose, blood eyes, and asks with full sincerity:

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Do you want to fuck me? I’1l let you do it. Jerry smiles.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: Not right now, but I appreciate the offer. Nyles pats Jerry on the leg, then continues hanging his h

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: I miss her, Jerry.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Sarah.  86.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: Harris? Nyles nods, still buried in his hands.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: I didn’t know you knew her. We all wish she could’ve been here. Nyles shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: I love her.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: Oh. I see. That’s interesting. Off this image of a kind dude consoling a heartbroken man

dialogues.speaker: MISTY, (PRE-LAP)
dialogues.text: Wake up. INT. NYLES’ AND MISTY’S BEDROOM - MORNING Nyles wakes up in bed. Another day. Misty moisturizes. Nyles GROOOOOANNNS --

dialogues.speaker: I./E. PRIUS / DESERT HIGHWAY
dialogues.text: Nyles drives down the road with a look of defeat on his f

dialogues.speaker: I./E. PRIUS / 91-FREEWAY
dialogues.text: The Prius blends in with the weekend traffic in Orange County, side-by-side with hundreds of dead-eyed drivers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Identical tract homes. Nyles parks the Prius by the curb front of one. He checks the number: 742. He checks the address on the GPS: 742 Woodflower St, Irvine. He gets out of the car and stands on the front lawn.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: ROY! I’m turning myself in! Torture me, fuck me, I don’t care! (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: NYLES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I've felt it all and there’s nothing left but this pit of sorrow! You were right, it’s dark down here! He lies on his back, sprawled on the crisp grass. Some NEIGHBORS pop their heads out. The front door opens. Roy hurries out to him.

dialogues.speaker: ROY
dialogues.text: (harsh whisper) What are you doing here?!

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: I surrender. You win. Roy helps Nyles up, smiling at his neighbors as he does.

dialogues.speaker: ROY
dialogues.text: Everything's okay, nothing to see. My brother-in-law, PTSD, Fallujah, 9/11. Real war hero. (quietly to Nyles) I’m not letting you ruin family day, so keep your mouth shut. Roy drags Nyles into his house. INT. ROY’S HOUSE - CONTINUOUS Pleasant, portrait of Jesus. TWINS (boy and girl, 6) on tricycles. A TEEN watches TV. Not what Nyles expected.

dialogues.speaker: ROY
dialogues.text: You can’t be here. WOMAN’S VOICE (0.S.) Who was that man?!

dialogues.speaker: ROY
dialogues.text: Goddammit. JAMIE (45), Roy’s wife, appears at the top of the stairs bathrobe, drying her hair.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Oh, hi, sorry, just got out of the shower.

dialogues.speaker: ROY
dialogues.text: Hey, sorry hon’, this is ...  88. It just now dawns on Roy that he doesn’t know Nyles’ name

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Nyles.

dialogues.speaker: ROY
dialogues.text: Nyles is an old friend.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: We’re not friends, we’re enemies. (to Jamie) You married this piece of shit?

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Excuse me.

dialogues.speaker: ROY
dialogues.text: He’s a ball buster, hon’. Nyles just stopped by to say hi. Tuna will be ready soon. We’ll be out back. Roy pulls Nyles away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nyles blankly takes in Roy’s yard. Idyllic suburbia. Pool Golden Retriever, BBQ and a smoker. A twin BOY (6) waters grass with a hose. His twin SISTER calls out from a swing

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: Push me! Feeling powerless at the moment, Nyles pushes the girl on swing. Roy walks up with beers, slightly calmer now.

dialogues.speaker: ROY
dialogues.text: (re: his twins) Can you believe I made these? If I had one less Mai Tai that night I'd have put the rubber on right and they wouldn’t be here. (then) Here’s to Mai Tais. Roy sips his beer, watching his kids with fatherly pride. and Nyles trade off pushing the swing.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: This is your life?

dialogues.speaker: ROY
dialogues.text: Not bad, huh? Beautiful wife, three beautiful kids. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: ROY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (pointing to his boy) Little retard is watering dog shit. It’s weird and beautiful. The boy scoops up a piece of dog shit, dumps it onto a pi in middle of the grass, and continues watering it.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: What about marriage being a “bottomless pit of sorrow?”

dialogues.speaker: ROY
dialogues.text: Shit, man, I’m not without my demons. Don’t crucify me. Things change. Priorities... change. Nyles stares at the kid, unpacking all of this. Roy picks on Nyles’ troubled mental state.

dialogues.speaker: ROY
dialogues.text: So what are you doing here? You have two minutes to drink that beer before I slit your throat and throw you in the smoker. (off Nyles’ look) I’m kidding. This is a PG house. Get on with it though. You’re scaring my wife. Nyles notices Jamie watching him through the blinds from second floor bedroom window. She shuts the blinds.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: I haven't seen you in a while.

dialogues.speaker: ROY
dialogues.text: Yeah, no shit. A bunch of rock climbers found me on the road that day and brought me to the hospital. Nurses wouldn’t let me sleep because they thought I'd fall into a coma. Died a slow, painful death.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: There’s nothing worse than dying slowly in the ICU.

dialogues.speaker: ROY
dialogues.text: Alzheimer’s. Way worse. Runs in my family. At least I don’t have to deal with that. Roy sips on his beer, suppressing some memory.  90.

dialogues.speaker: ROY
dialogues.text: I had a lot of anger for you, man. I’m never gonna see my kids grow up, I’m never gonna walk Madison down the aisle. But you wouldn’t know shit about that, would you? Roy glares at Nyles, then takes a more enlightened approa

dialogues.speaker: ROY
dialogues.text: I admit, my head may have been up my own ass, I might not have fully grasped what I put you through, but that little hospital stint opened my eyes. Today was always a good day here. Matty tending his dog shit, Jamie in the prime of her womanhood at forty-five. Madison's gonna draw a family portrait later where we’re all animals. I’ma goddamn grizzly. I don’t have to watch my family grow up to hate me. Can't beat that. Roy glances over at Nyles, sensing that the dude is a los soul at the moment.

dialogues.speaker: ROY
dialogues.text: You gotta find your Irvine.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: I don’t have an Irvine.

dialogues.speaker: ROY
dialogues.text: We all have an Irvine. (then) Who was that looney bitch that blindsided me, anyway?

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: (defensive) Don’t call her that. Roy shakes his head at Nyles while drinking his beer.

dialogues.speaker: ROY
dialogues.text: You brought her to the cave, didn’t you? Goddamn, didn’t you learn anything? Nyles stares ahead, still pushing Madison.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: She followed me in.  91.

dialogues.speaker: ROY
dialogues.text: Hey. At least you have each other. Can’t imagine anything worse than going through this shit alone. Nyles stops pushing, hit with the reality that they don’t have each other anymore... He does have to go through thi shit alone. Madison looks back at Nyles.

dialogues.speaker: ROY
dialogues.text: Okay, you gotta go now.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Can I stay for dinner?

dialogues.speaker: ROY
dialogues.text: It’s probably best if we don’t see each other again. (then) It’s not you, it’s me. A moment as Nyles absorbs this. Even Roy is done with Nyl

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Kill me? Roy takes him in -- this defeated shell of a man.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: The traffic.

dialogues.speaker: ROY
dialogues.text: Side yard. (to Madison) Daddy’1l be right back, honey. EXT. ROY’S HOUSE - SIDE YARD - MOMENTS LATER Roy leads Nyles to the side yard and shuts the gate behin them so that they’re out of view from the kids.

dialogues.speaker: ROY
dialogues.text: (quietly) K, uh... Get in the recycle bin. Roy unlocks a storage bin and pulls out the HUNTING BOW. Nyles climbs into the empty recycle bin and faces Roy.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: You actually own that?  92.

dialogues.speaker: ROY
dialogues.text: It’s my eldest’s. Caught him hunting cats. At least I don’t have to see him grow up to be a serial killer. Roy cocks the arrow into place -- AIMS at Nyles’ HEAD...

dialogues.speaker: ROY
dialogues.text: I hope you find it, man. Then AIMS at Nyles’ HEART -- and FIRES -- Nyles collapses into the bin -- the lid shuts closed. We HOLD ON the recycle bin for a few more seconds as Roy leaves the side yard... TILT UP to the NIGHT SKY -- All the stars, all the constellations -- and BACK DOWN to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Nyles and Sarah sit handcuffed on the curb as the Grumpy Man gives his statement to the Cop. Back to the la time Nyles and Sarah saw each other.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: I’m an awful person, whatever, but you're that predictable. She turns away. Nyles does the same. The Cop finishes taking the Grumpy Man’s statement and he to Nyles and Sarah. Just before he reaches them -- Sarah turns back to Nyles, determination in her eyes:

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I’m getting the fuck out of here. Nyles doesn’t understand...

dialogues.speaker: COP 1
dialogues.text: Okay, up we go -- The Cop helps Nyles up, and as his back is turned, Sarah, hands still cuffed behind her back, manages to grab his G

dialogues.speaker: COP 1 COP 2
dialogues.text: Whoa whoa whoa! Drop the weapon!  93. Sarah starts FIRING at NYLES, everybody SCATTERS -- But the Grumpy Man, Mr. Hot Dog Man himself, is fearless. pulls out a .44 MAGNUM, aims it at Sarah -- BANG!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah shoots awake, sits up, fucking done with this day. She goes straight to the BATHROOM -- She flings open the steamed shower door to find Abe --

dialogues.speaker: ABE
dialogues.text: Hey you.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: No. This is done. This never should've happened. We both deserve every awful thing that’s coming to us because we are shitty people. But I’m done being shitty.

dialogues.speaker: ABE
dialogues.text: Uhh, okay. You’re not going to tell Tala though, right?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I already fucking told her and it doesn’t make a difference. And with that Sarah SLAMS the shower door, cracking it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PUSH IN on Sarah behind the wheel, a woman on a mission.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah’s car screeches into the EMPTY parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: Sarah paces back and forth at the ENTRANCE, waiting for t library to open. BEHIND HER we see the LIBRARIAN (40s) inside, unlocking the glass doors and opening them.

dialogues.speaker: LIBRARIAN
dialogues.text: off to an early start --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah slips right by and we follow her INSIDE --

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Science. I need the science section.

dialogues.speaker: LIBRARIAN
dialogues.text: What type of science?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Time loops? Time travel?

dialogues.speaker: LIBRARIAN
dialogues.text: Try aisle six... The Librarian follows slowly behind Sarah -- Sarah turns down aisle six, scans titles: Quantum Mechani In Search of Schrédinger’s Cat, The Infinity Puzzle...

dialogues.speaker: LIBRARIAN
dialogues.text: What are you looking for exactly? I can help narrow it down...

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I walked into a cave that sucked me into some type of hellish wormhole and now I’ve been stuck living the same day over and over again and I need to find a way out. The Librarian gives her a blank stare.

dialogues.speaker: LIBRARIAN
dialogues.text: Maybe try the Internet? Sarah stops. Looks over. That’s it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From behind the computer, ANGLE ON Sarah as she sits befo this machine which may hold all the answers. As she gets work typing we slowly PUSH IN on her face -- TIME SPEEDS UP BEHIND HER -- library guests pass by in a -- but Sarah never moves, her eyes just rapidly scanning every page she reads, absorbing every video she watches - -- FLASH TO diagrams of WORMHOLES, BLACK HOLES, EQUATIONS COSMOLOGICAL DIAGRAMS --—  95. -- FLASH TO various entries typed into GOOGLE: cosmology, Magnetic vortex, quantum suicide, parallel universes -- PUSHING IN on Sarah, her face fills the frame, pupils shr -- FLASH TO Sarah waking up -- she hops out of bed -- Her speeds away in a dust cloud -- OVER and OVER again -- -- FLASH TO a Stephen Hawking TED Talk -- Sarah furiously takes notes -- -- Sarah's eyes grow heavy as she watches a dated TV spec on time travel... until she falls asleep at the computer -- Sarah WAKES UP -- back at the guest house -- FUCK -- a jumps out of bed -- Her car speeds away -- PUSHING IN on Sarah’s face -- on her EYE -- -- As Howard assembles the ALTAR, Sarah swipes a TAPE MEA from Howard’s tool box and walks off, but STOPS when --

dialogues.speaker: NYLES, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Sarah! I see your car! I know you're here! She hides up against a wall as Nyles passes by, then runs -- Sarah exits a Superstore carrying a bunch of TOOLS and CHEMICALS. The same young BOY selling candy from before approaches. She ignores him. Then stops. Goes back and gi him a 100 DOLLAR BILL.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: (Subtitled Spanish) Make sure you spend it all today. -- FLASH TO Sarah at the mouth of the CAVE, measuring it, pacing back and forth, pouring weird chemicals in the dir She strides in, staring at a stopwatch, the ORANGE ORB engulfs her into a BLACK VOID -- We PULL OUT from Sarah’s PUPIL -- she rubs her weary eyes she SKYPES with a PROFESSOR:

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR
dialogues.text: -+. we're kind of circling determinism, so there’s really only one possible future given the laws of our universe --  96.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: -- BUT. Wait. You’re wrong. Hintz argued that a Reissner-Nordstrom-de Sitter black hole would allow an observer access to the indeterministic universe on the other side of the Cauchy horizon. The Professor stares back.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR
dialogues.text: Okay. Sounds like you don’t need my help. Take care -- The Professor signs off. -- FLASH TO Sarah, face-to-face with SPUDS’ GOAT. She pet endearingly, apologetically, then walks her INTO the cave SEE the ORANGE FLASH and hear the goat bleat. -- FLASH TO Sarah leaning over the fence at Spuds’ GOAT P weighing something as she looks at the goat, who stares b -- Sarah, outside the cave, straps a PACK FULL OF C4 onto same goat’s back. She walks the goat into the cave, out o view... but after a moment Sarah RUNS OUT -- without the -- takes cover behind a boulder, detonator in hand -- and

dialogues.speaker: CLICK
dialogues.text: -- FLASH TO a VIDEO depicting a theoretical journey throu the UNIVERSE, through a WORMHOLE -- leading us to: BLACKNESS, NOTHINGNESS -- except for a SINGLE, DISTANT ST ... THE STAR EXPLODES, filling a PERFECTLY CLEAR NIGHT SK Now we're BACK TO the starting ANGLE -- behind the comput Sarah stops reading, stops typing, and sits back in her c She looks to The Librarian, cataloguing books at the coun

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I think I got it. The Librarian smiles politely, then goes back to her work

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nyles, dejected and back in the lounge chair, stares at t pool. Pure misery and emptiness. The guy just can’t move

dialogues.speaker: SARAH, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Still here, huh?  97. Nyles turns his head to see Sarah approaching -- and fall of his chair. He blinks to be sure he isn’t hallucinating

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Hey! You’re here.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Yup.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Wow, you look great.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Yeah. Well I can’t age.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Right. It’s awkward... She looks down at him, still on the groun

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: So, how you been?

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Bad. (stands up) I mean, yeah bad, look, can I just say something... I am SO sorry, for everything, for lying, for not telling you about our “previous encounters.” All of it, it was not cool. And I don’t blame you for being mad at me. But, I’ve been thinking about it, we had a really good thing going before I screwed it up. So, do you think we could just start over? I feel like we owe that to ourselves.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Are you done? Nyles thinks for a moment. Am I done?

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Good. I think I found a way out. off Nyles --  98.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON Sarah as she explains her theory to Nyles.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: «+. all lying entirely within a Cauchy horizon, and though the chronology protection hypothesis and quantum fluctuations theoretically don’t allow for traveling back in time, it really comes down to nature always inhibiting us. So, the general consensus is eradicate the energy source and all should reset. She looks at Nyles, preoccupied and clearly not following

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Nature prevents time travel. The earthquake broke nature.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: (unconvincing) Right. I hear that.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: No, listen, this is serious. Sarah leans forward and grabs her PURSE from the vanity -

dialogues.speaker: ERIN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Please, don’t move -- WIDE TO REVEAL: Erin, thoroughly annoyed as she tries to Sarah's hair for the wedding.

dialogues.speaker: ERIN
dialogues.text: I don’t know what you’re talking about, but we only have half an hour until photos and I still need to get ready.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Then get ready. I'll finish up. Erin puts her hands up, glad to be done, and leaves. Sarah takes out LIPSTICK and draws a DIAGRAM on the mirro starting with a LONG TUBE --  99.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: This is the cave. It’s also life, birth and death, our consciousness, the timeline we all live on, but it’s simpler to think of it solely as the cave. We enter here -- She circles the left entry --

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: -- and what’s supposed to happen in life is we just walk through this tube to the other end, continuing on this regular timeline. But, much like an earthquake can break pipes underground, it broke our pipe. She circles a section of the tube --

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: This is the part where it all turns orange, where we’re sucked in. For exactly 3.2 seconds we lose control of our bodies, and what’s happening is we’re being sucked down into this fissure caused by the earthquake, back to the moment we wake up. Sarah draws a line down from the fissure, back to the sta

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: (trying to follow) Okay... I really missed you.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Nyles, focus. It’s really not that hard to understand. Here -- (circling the fissure again) This is a highly concentrated energy source. Remember, you said it yourself. Energy Is Everything. We're trapped in a box of energy. Sarah draws a BOX around the entire graphic.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: That's all this day is. A box of energy. (pointing to the fissure) We destroy the energy source in that 3.2 second window, we break the box. At least I think. Sarah goes back to applying her make-up, pleased with her  100.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: And then what, there’s like more boxes outside the box?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I don’t know, maybe we wake up and it’s today, maybe it’s twenty years from now, or we're dead under a pile of rocks. I can’t be sure of any of it, that’s why it’s a theory. But we have to try. Sarah’s making somewhat of a convincing argument, but Nyl remains skeptical.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Okay. And by “break the box,” you mean...?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: We blow up ourselves and the cave in that 3.2 second window. Then we're out. Sarah moves onto her mascara, so confident in her plan.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: I dunno, I mean, we've killed ourselves so many times already and we're still here, in “this box,” right? I mean, I don’t wanna shit on your idea, you've clearly spent a lot of time learning all about this stuff --

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Well, technically, I’ve spent no time on it, since this isn’t real time, it’s all time spent outside of time, but go on.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: I just think you might be setting yourself up for disappointment again. Remember your karma experiment?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: This is different. She puts down her mascara and looks him in the eyes.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I tested it.  101. Sarah moves into the BEDROOM and starts changing into her DRESS. Nyles is stuck on her last line though...

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: How did you test it?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I tried it with Spuds’ goat. I sent her into the cave, blew her up, and... she’s gone. I don’t know where she went, but she isn’t here anymore. (then) Zip me up. Nyles zips her dress, still unsure...

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: The goat’s gone?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Yeah. Crazy, right? So, get through today, don’t do anything too crazy, and tonight, meet me at the cave so we can peace the fuck out of this shithole. Sarah checks her dress in the armoire mirror. Nyles sits the bed, processing. Did she actually find a way out?

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: You sure you don’t wanna run a few more tests first?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: What? No. What are you talking about? Sarah sits on the bed and begins lacing up on her shoes.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: The cave will still be there tomorrow... I just don’t wanna rush into anything, you know, in case something actually does happen.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Rush? Nyles, we've been stuck in here for an eternity.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Yeah, no, I know. I guess I just really saw this conversation going differently, y’know?  102. She looks at Nyles. The same dude she once had a fling wi may have even loved, but who remains unchanged. Same wrin Hawaiian shirt, same dirty swim trunks...

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Holy shit. You’re scared to leave.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: No, I’m not. I just don’t WANT to leave. There’s a difference.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: What’s the difference?

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: I wanna stay with you.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Everything we’re doing in here is meaningless. You know that, right? This isn’t real.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: It’s real to me. Look... (takes a breath) I love you. How about that? Sarah continues with her other shoe, deflecting --

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: You don’t love me. I’m literally the only other human being stuck in here with you.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: No, what about Roy? I don’t love him. Sarah looks at him: Come on.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: So, you're saying that out there, in the real world, with millions of choices, you'd still want to be with me? Nyles hesitates for a second too long... Sarah clocks it.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Yeah. Absolutely.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Bullshit. You can’t possibly know that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, would you want to be with me?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Fuck no. Sarah heads back into the bathroom --

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Right, see, we “can’t possibly know that.” Your words. But what I DO know is that we’re good together, here, in this world.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: You've lost your mind. Nyles stands --

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: That’s what love’s all about! Sane people don’t fall in love, don’t be so afraid of it. I’m not going to fuck you over. And if you get mad at me again, just take a few years off and then come back. We’ll still have our youth.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I want my life back, Nyles!

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Why? It’s not like things were working out so great for us out there. I mean, I know you’re screwing Abe, so if your plan works you'll have to deal with that whole mess. The color drains from Sarah’s face.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: How do you know about that? He sighs.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Viktor and Rolf Flowerbomb. She is livid, ashamed, as she packs her purse -- 103.  104.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: But it doesn’t matter. I don’t judge you for the past, that’s kind of my whole thing.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Wow, YOU don’t judge ME? That’s rich coming from the guy who lied about us fucking “thousands of times.”

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: I said I was sorry!

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Yeah, well apology not accepted. Good talk, Nyles. Don’t come with me, I don’t care. She turns to leave -- but he’s in the way.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Can you move? If this is my last day, I’m not wasting it with you. Nyles stares back, he wants her to stay... but she won’t down. He steps aside and she leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nyles wanders out the front door in a daze. He stops and stares up at the sun, like he’s trying to blind himself..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nyles trudges down the dirt road, AWAY from the estate, a guests drive toward the wedding. He passes the sign for “Tala & Abe’s Wedding - November 9

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah, all dressed for the wedding, straight-faced as the PHOTOGRAPHER positions the family members around Tala and in front of a cactus. Sarah forces a smile for the photo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nyles walks in the middle of the road, head hanging, look pathetic. A passing CAR blares its horn. Nyles doesn’t re  105.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOS: Tala and Abe share their vows as family tears up. Sa smiles, standing by Tala in full support. She glances out the audience -- everyone falls for the love on display.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nyles turns up another dirt road, the sun descends below mountains behind him -- and THE EARTHQUAKE HITS. Nyles pauses for a moment. A thought crosses him, he look west: The cave is open. Maybe Sarah’s heading in. He sighs, then keeps walking forth into the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: MISTY, (PRE-LAP)
dialogues.text: And Commitment is “the state or quality of being dedicated to a cause, activity, etcetera.”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Misty looks out at the silent guests.

dialogues.speaker: TALA
dialogues.text: Woo-hoo! Tala and Abe stand and clap. Everyone else joins in appla

dialogues.speaker: MISTY
dialogues.text: Without further ado, let me bring up the maid of honor, the actual big sister of the bride, Sarah. All eyes land on Sarah, seated across from Tala. She take breath... and heads onto the dance floor. She takes the m

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Thanks Misty, that was great. Sarah looks directly at Tala throughout.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Tala. My baby sister, Tala. What can I say that hasn’t been said? Heh... Even from this angle, I can see a very faint halo of light around your head -- hovering just above those angelic cheekbones.  106. Tala’ cheekbones radiate. Sarah sighs to herself, this is ridiculous... But sees Tala beaming at her... and actuall gets a little choked up. What are these feelings I’m feel

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: This world is bizarre... things happen, life happens, and it’s easy to bear down and just go through the motions day after day, after day... But, my sweet little sis’, you are so open to the wonder of it all. You have this hopefulness that’s special and rare. Every morning you get up and you confidently charge forth toward the life you've dreamt up for yourself. Your joy, this joyous energy, it's contagious and it’s just...

dialogues.speaker: SARAH AND NYLES
dialogues.text: Staring at each other across the campfire --

dialogues.speaker: NYLES SARAH
dialogues.text: «+. Everything. ... Everything.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: .-. it’s everything. Sarah pauses, struck by the warmth of this memory. She swallows her vulnerability, and looks back at Tala --

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Big sisters are supposed to teach baby sisters, but I will today and forever, and ever and ever, be learning from you. The two sisters share a blissful, teary smile.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: So, now, Abe... Abe leans forward, expecting some kind words...

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: You fucking hurt her and I’1l stab your little fucking dick with a fork, I swear to god.  107. Stunned reactions from the crowd. Sarah smiles, drops the mic, and walks off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nyles sulks at the bar, swirling a glass of whiskey. PUSH on that empty mug of his... Until he DROPS his face down the bar. As we first met him. Gram Parsons’ “Return of th Grievous Angel” plays throughout. Darla slides up and rubs his leg. Nyles shoots up.

dialogues.speaker: DARLA
dialogues.text: You okay, sweetheart?

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: I've felt everything I'll ever feel so I'll never feel ever again. Darla looks to Ted the Bartender --

dialogues.speaker: DARLA
dialogues.text: What’re you pouring this kid, Ted?

dialogues.speaker: TED THE BARTENDER
dialogues.text: That’s his first drink.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: I thought I knew how to live. But I didn’t. Or, I don’t? You know what I mean.

dialogues.speaker: DARLA
dialogues.text: Darlin’, take a look around: whatever you're after, it ain’t here... But now TIME SLOWS for Nyles... and _we see this moment differently than before as he locks eyes with Darla -- He turns back to the bar, digesting this odd profundity, staring into the MIRROR behind dusty liquor bottles -- FROM OVER NYLES’ SHOULDER, REFLECTED IN THE MIRROR, WE WA A giddy Nyles leading a blindfolded Sarah into her surpri shindig filled with decorations and a giant ‘HAPPY MILLIO BIRTHDAY, SARAH’ sign... that joyous tableau from their e days together. He removes her blindfold --

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: (touched, beaming) Have I really been here that long?  108.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: You’re asking the wrong guy -- Nyles lifts up a CONFETTI CANNON and blasts her face -- FROM NYLES’ POV, CLOSE UP AND DIRECT INTO SARAH’S GRIN -- Confetti pieces flutter around Sarah, radiant with an unbridled joy we haven’t seen. She leans in and squeezes Nyles in a hug, then lets go and steps back, bringing us

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO THE BAR, IN THE PRESENT
dialogues.text: ON NYLES, lost in this memory as Gram Parsons SWELLS: “,..Twenty-thousand roads I went down, down, down, and th all lead me straight back home to you...” Darla, weirded out, looks to Ted the Bartender --

dialogues.speaker: DARLA
dialogues.text: You sure he didn’t take something?

dialogues.speaker: TED THE BARTENDER
dialogues.text: He’s sober. Kid’s just moping there. Nyles turns to them, quickly piecing together a haphazard plan. He JOLTS up and defiantly shoots his whiskey, shattering the glass with a glare for Ted --

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: I’m a fucking adult, Thaddeus.

dialogues.speaker: TED THE BARTENDER
dialogues.text: Talk to me like that and you'll be pulling your teeth from the bar. Nyles sizes up the barflies leering at him. He turns to T and holds a peace sign... and rotates it into a middle fi Nyles LUNGES over the bar and latches onto Ted’s shirt as some BIKERS grab Nyles’ legs -- the place erupts into CHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We HEAR the sound of a FIGHT: SHOUTING, GLASS BREAKING -- The front door flies open and the two bikers hurl Nyles f first onto the gravel parking lot then go back inside. Nyles looks into his clenched hand: TED’S CAR KEYS. Nyles pushes himself up -- with a bloody, broken nose -- RUNS to Ted’s PICK-UP truck, gets in, REVS the engine --  109.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah drives her car along a rough dirt road, deeply focu INT. TED’S PICK-UP - NIGHT Nyles presses down the gas -- SPEEDING DOWN THE HIGHWAY - He CRACKS his nose back into place, then -- He hits a POTHOLE -- POP!!! -- he blows a tire -- -- and SKIDS TO A STOP on the shoulder. Nyles jumps out of the truck, checks the tire: torn to sh and bent in on itself.

dialogues.speaker: FUUUUCK
dialogues.text: Nyles looks down the road -- and takes off RUNNING --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah gets out of her car at the dead end of a dirt road. pops the trunk and pulls out a DUFFEL BAG, throws it over shoulder, and powers forth into the desert -- on a missio

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spuds FIRES a shot at the Mustache Man target. As he nods with pride at his perfect shot --

dialogues.speaker: NYLES, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Don’t shoot, Spuds! Spuds turns and aims the gun at this mysterious man runni out of the darkness and into the flood lights -- a lunati drenched in sweat, caked in dirt, and out of breath --

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: I need help! A ride... Anything...

dialogues.speaker: SPUDS
dialogues.text: Who the fuck are you? Spuds doesn’t flinch. Nyles plays his only card:  110.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Thirty years ago you met a woman named Tracy Holmes at a bar in Aberdeen, and after she popped your cherry in the little boy’s room, she left town and you never saw her again. Spuds’ hands tremble at the memory, still raw, while maintaining his aim.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Spuds. I’m your son. Spuds sheds a tear. He lowers his gun, totally buying Nyl story. He walks up to Nyles and pulls him in for a tight

dialogues.speaker: SPUDS
dialogues.text: I always had a feeling. Mid hug, Nyles glances at the GOAT PEN and considers chec to see if Sarah was telling truth, if the goat is really gone. But the clock's ticking. He gets out of the hug --

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: I love you, Dad. But I really need your help. The love of my life might be leaving forever. Spuds wipes his nose and looks at Nyles with fatherly eye

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE CAVE. Open and ready. SARAH. Calm. Resolute. She stands just beyond the mouth, staring at it. She takes a deep breath and pulls on a VES LINED WITH C4. She walks toward the cave. Just as she’s about to cross the threshold --

dialogues.speaker: NYLES, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Wait!!! Sarah!!! Sarah turns to see a DIRT BIKE weaving through the valley Spuds is driving, Nyles holds on tight to his waist. Spuds skids to a stop. Nyles jumps off and runs toward Sa

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Goddamnit. What is it, Nyles?  111.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: I blew it again! You were right, I was scared, but I’m not anymore! We’re all lost, but somehow we found each other. And yes, I’m quoting myself, but I hope you can look past that, because I know you feel it, too.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: You don’t know what I feel. You don’t know me.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: But maybe I do! (composes himself) Sarah, from the moment I saw you --

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I don’t want another one of your fucking speeches, Nyles... She looks toward the cave.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: You get one more sentence.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Okay, okay, okay -- Nyles thinks for a moment...

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Even though I pretend not to be, I've realized I’m completely co- dependent, but now I’m cool with it because life is meant to be shared... semi-colon... I need you for survival --

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: That’s your one sentence --

dialogues.speaker: WAIT
dialogues.text: She stops.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: .»+.- I need you for survival, comma, but this is so much more than that... colon... (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: NYLES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I know you better than anyone knows you, and that day we saw the dinosaurs, you said to really know a person you have to see their entire package, the good and the bad, well you've see mine, and I’ve seen yours, and you have an excellent package. Ampersand you're my favorite person I’ve ever met, and yes, it seems like crazy odds that a person I’d meet stuck in a time loop would end up being my favorite person, but you know what else has crazy odds? Getting stuck in a fucking time loop... Dot dot dot --

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Ellipses.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Yes, ellipses, thank you. Ellipses, I hope blowing ourselves up works, but if it doesn’t, it’s irrelevant for me, as long as I’m with you. And if it kills us... well... Sarah Isabel Harris, I'd rather die with you than live in this world without you, emphatic period. Sarah’s speechless for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: That was a grammatical nightmare.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Yeah, hopefully that didn’t distract from my point. Nyles locks eyes with her, letting his declaration of commitment linger for as long as he needs to. Sarah finally breaks the silence: A beat...

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: What if we get sick of each other?

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: (smiling) We're already sick of each other. It’s the best.  113.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: I can survive just fine without you. But there’s a chance that life can be a little less mundane with you in it.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Yes, less mundane. That’s a very low bar, great place to start. She cracks a smile.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Then I’1l try it for now. Nyles beams. Spuds CLAPS, watching from his bike.

dialogues.speaker: SPUDS
dialogues.text: And that is love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the inside looking out, Sarah and Nyles stand at the mouth of the cave. Her in her C4 vest, him with a broken in his swim trunks and Hawaiian shirt. A perfect engageme photo. They begin their walk in.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: So did that goat thing actually work or was that bullshit?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Too late, you already committed.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Son of a bitch. Sarah takes his hand.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Hey, where do you wanna go on our first date when this for sure works? The orange light BRIGHTENS on their faces. They look at each other, still walking forward...

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: In case I don’t see you again -- Sarah kisses Nyles, the ORANGE ORB SWELLS --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ENGULFED BY ORB --— MAKING OUT -— SARAH’S HAND ON THE DETONATOR -- CLICK -—-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yesterday, last year, today, tomorrow... Sarah and Nyles float on an extra large pizza raft in a pool, burritos in hand, horchata in the pepperoni cupholders.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: There’s one thing I still really don’t understand?

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Only one thing?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: How did you find the cave in the first place? You had to find it that first day at the wedding, but it’s like two miles from the party, not by any roads. What were you doing out there? Nyles takes a big bite of his burrito.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Seriously. Honesty and communication are key to a healthy relationship.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: But is there any answer that’1ll be satisfying to you?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Yeah, because an answer is inherently satisfying. It satisfies the pursuit of truth. And I like truth. I get off on truth. Nyles stares directly at Sarah.  115.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: But does it not run the risk of disappointment if I tell you what happened? By this point your mind is made up about me, whether you love me, hate me, or anything in between. And if I tell you how I found the cave, that might give you a sense of truth, but will it be satisfaction? Our energy should be focused on pursuing what gives us -- Sarah SLURPS her horchata loudly, growing peeved.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Isn't it more exciting to live your life always having some sense of mystery?

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: No. That’s pretentious. And dumb. Nyles ponders this for a moment. A small raft with the bo Tecate on it floats by.

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: Yeah. I guess it is. Sarah smiles. She stops the Tecate box and grabs a beer.

dialogues.speaker: SARAH
dialogues.text: Beer?

dialogues.speaker: NYLES
dialogues.text: I’m good. Watching my figure. (then) Look. A turtle. Nyles points to the scarred TORTOISE walking toward them the other side of the backyard. As they gaze at it -- “Forever and Ever” by Demis Roussos kicks in... We FLOAT UP AND AWAY from Nyles and Sarah... And as we ge farther away we see they’re in this pool by themselves, i the backyard of a secluded desert house... Scattered civilization, farther away, dinos in the distan up into a cloud, until we can’t see shit anymore. CUT TO BLACK.
